Description:
Contracts Officer
EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency, operating satellites that monitor the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
It’s an exciting time to be working at EUMETSAT. As an organisation we’re operating a fleet of satellites delivering weather and climate-related satellite data and images to our users worldwide; helping protect lives, property and industries. However, you don’t need to be an engineer or a scientist to make a positive contribution. Our specialist administrative and support functions play an equally important role in the success of the EUMESAT programmes and are valued members of the EUMETSAT family.
The Contracts Division provides contractual and commercial expertise across the organisation and ensures that best value for money is achieved by an efficient procurement process. The Division provides contractual and commercial expertise to the organisation, performs checks and balances to ensure compliance with the procurement rules, and ensures that procurements are timely and well managed.

Description:
Cloud Services Engineer
EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency - monitoring the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
EUMETSAT opened a portfolio of cloud-based big data services in 2020 to bring users to its data. The portfolio is based on advanced architectures, applications, user portals and hosted processing capabilities with full integration across the entire cloud stack from Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) up to Data as a Service (DaaS). EUMETSAT has a key role in several cloud-based international initiatives such as DIAS, WekEO, European Weather Cloud (EWC) and Destination Earth.
Within the Competence Area of Cloud Services in the Digital Solutions and SAF Division (DSA), the Cloud Services Engineer will be the main technical focal point for all cloud services and solutions developed by DSA that have a focus on downstream applications. The postholder will manage the engineering, evolution and maintenance of those cloud services, including procurement and management of industrial support and services needed for their development, implementation, evolution and achieving the targeted service levels

Description:
Cambi has developed our own tool to help our customers achieve high process performance and smooth operation of all our Thermal Hydrolysis Plant (THP) installations and ancillaries. We call this tool PLUS - an online platform for process monitoring, analysis and support.
We are now seeking to strengthen our PLUS team with a highly skilled Data Engineer. As a successful candidate, you will play a key role in the further development and deployment of PLUS across our plants worldwide. This is a unique opportunity to get involved at an early stage and be a key player in developing one of the company’s main strategic activities.
As a PLUS Data Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining data streaming solutions from our industrial automation systems. Your key responsibilities will include setting up data pipelines from the plant floor to the end-user, ensuring that real-time data is continuously updated and available for analysis. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to be involved in this data analysis. You will work closely with a cross-functional team of experts to design and implement scalable, efficient, and reliable data streaming pipelines. You will also integrate new data sources, troubleshoot and debug streaming issues, and ensure data quality and integrity. Furthermore, you will play a significant role in implementing best practices for data management, data security, and data privacy.

Job_title: Sommerjobb for data scientists / data engineers — Oslo
Description:
En relevant sommerjobb er gull verdt for deg som ønsker erfaring og muligheten til å sette teori i praksis. Jobb med erfarne Bekk-konsulenter på aktuelle oppdrag, lær masse og vis oss hva du kan – og kanskje leder det til en jobb etter studiene! Sommerjobb i 2023 er fra 13. juni til 28. juli.
Hvem er du?
Du studerer datateknikk, informatikk, kybernetikk, matematikk, eller du har en annen relevant utdannelse. Du har et ønske om å få erfaring som data scientist eller data engineer, og interessen for å løse problemer med data bør være en drivkraft for deg.

Description:
The Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces family includes online marketplaces and services in the Nordics. Every day, we help millions of people buy, sell, hire and get hired. Are you a skilled Data Engineer with a passion for building high-quality software and infrastructure? Do you have experience with Kafka and Java technologies and a desire to learn more? If so, we want you to join our Data team!
Our newly-formed Data Platform is embarking on a journey towards Data Mesh, where shared data is discoverable, addressable, trustworthy, and secure. Description:
Er du en nytenkende og forretningsorientert Data Engineer som ønsker å være en sentral bidragsyter i reise mot å bli en datadrevet organisasjon? Ønsker du å utforske og finne gode løsninger for å skape innsikt som påvirker viktige beslutninger knyttet til utvikling av varesortiment i flere av Norges dagligvarekjeder?
Kategori / Innkjøp (KI) i NorgesGruppen består av en tverrfaglig gjeng som brenner for å realisere forbedringer og ny funksjonalitet med fokus på verdi for våre kunder. Vi har mange planer og ønsker, og er midt oppi et teknologisk løft som gjør at vi trenger flere dyktige data engineers med på laget.
Om NorgesGruppen
NorgesGruppen er landets største handelshus. V åre rundt 40.000 medarbeidere står på hver dag for å gjøre hverdagen enklere for folk flest. Vi brenner for å gjøre dagligvarene billigere og bedre, inspirerer til gode matopplevelser, og bidrar til grønne og sunne valgmuligheter.

Responsibilities
You will be joining the Data & Analytics team, which is a part of the global Product & Tech located in Oslo and Copenhagen. The team is responsible for all data engineering, BI reporting, and machine learning projects to enable data-driven decision making for internal business leads as well as for external partners such as banks, insurance companies and affiliates. Data is a key priority for our business and we're moving fast to unlock its full potential.
At the moment, we are several dedicated data professionals. Our responsibilities cover the full scope of project delivery; with a starting point in stakeholder needs and desires, we set up and maintain the data lake, build ETL/ELT pipelines and design final solutions. We are operating on a modern cloud-based data architecture powered by AWS Redshift and Microsoft Power BI. The complete system landscape includes a new event-based platform architecture, legacy MySQL databases, marketing and advertising platforms and CRM and CMS solutions.
In your new role as a Data Engineer with Axo Group, you will take ownership and governance of all data flows between various systems to ensure quality, reliability and performance. An important part of the job is the management of the master data model in Power BI that enables all our standard business reporting. This work includes data transformations in the data lake (SQL) and data modelling in Power BI (DAX).

Job_title: We are looking for a Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer
Pnr 15402

Job Description:
Your work mainly consists of transforming raw data into meaningful insights for the operations.
Transformations are mainly done with SQL, modelling the data in an appropriate way ready for analytics. The data is then put in Power BI data models ready for self-service and visualization in Power BI.
You will work closely with the stakeholders both in Operations department and our DataOps department. A big part of the job is to efficiently translate business requirements into robust deliverables.

Description:
Overview:
Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker develops high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions that enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years and today, Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems, and a strong reputation among its customers. Worldwide, more than 7,500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations on all continents.

New opportunity for a Field Service Engineer to install and support high technology equipment in research, pharmaceutical, university and government labs for Bruker BioSpin, a leading manufacturer of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and compact magnetic resonance (CMR) spectroscopy instruments and accessories. The Field Service Engineer works with highly complex equipment that requires advanced understanding of these instruments to perform installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair service activities.

Description:
This job will provide you with an opportunity to further your career alongside some of the best and most passionate technology experts from around the world in a leading company within the test, measurement and data analytics industry. You will be a strong contributor collaborating closely with colleagues from various business functions.
At HBK, we live up to our three values: Be True, Own It and Aim High. We believe in absolute integrity – it’s how we win for stakeholders, the environment and each other. We believe in teamwork and keeping our promises – to ourselves and others. Finally, we believe in being bold and positive. This is how we perform at our best and achieve greater success.
The position
We are currently looking for a Project Engineer for our team in Engineering Services at our HBK site based in Kolbotn, Norway, supporting on projects big and small.
Our new Project Engineer will be responsible for supporting our customers and colleagues with measurement projects in the field of mechanical quantities such as strain, torque, force, displacement, acceleration and vibration. This is the perfect role for someone who wants a 50/50 theoretical and practical job.

Job_title: Azure Data Engineer with DataBricks - Oslo
Description:
: The Azure Data Engineer will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable and efficient data solutions for clients using Azure DataBricks and DataWarehouse. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering and be familiar with modern data technologies and techniques.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with clients to understand their data requirements and design and implement data solutions to meet their needs.
Build and maintain ETL pipelines to extract, transform, and load data into DataBricks and DataWarehouse.
Develop and maintain data models and architecture to ensure scalability, performance, and security of the data.

Requirements:

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. Description:
Aker BP’s vision is to become the leading exploration and production company within oil and gas. We plan to achieve that by producing natural resources with low emissions and costs, while at the same time creating jobs, along with values for our owners and the broader society. Measured in production, we are one of the largest independent publicly listed oil companies in Europe. We have big plans for the future, which include further growth and a desire to improve the industry.


Drilling & Wells is responsible for delivery of large project portfolio with total net resources of more than 700 million barrels of oil equivalents, and a comprehensive exploration campaign to support future organic growth. You will be reporting to D&W Manager in one of our Assets with the ambition to develop Aker BP to the next level in the driling industry and change the oil and gas industry. You will also have an active role in Aker BP’s improvement and digitalization agenda finding better and smarter ways of working.

At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. Description:
Company Description

We are a well-funded not-for-profit project tasked with building the open-source DHIS2 platform, the world’s most widely-deployed health information system. The project is based at the HISP Centre at the University of Oslo (UiO) where we operate as an independent software development organization.
With us you get a chance to work on problems which really matter: Improving the health and well-being of people around the world through access and use of information. Our platform is used in more than 90 countries worldwide and has the scale and adoption which will allow you to make an impact globally.
We give you a lot of flexibility and freedom and there is no micro-management or strict hierarchies. At DHIS2 we believe you will do your best work if you fully understand the context in which the system operates. As a result you are encouraged to engage directly with our projects, take part in the design process and get feedback from users in the field.

Attensi is one of Norway's fastest growing technology companies. We make 3D gamified simulation training for large corporations and are a global leader in our field. Our solutions create a realistic ‘learning by doing’ environment in a virtual 3D setting and makes training fun and engaging!
Do you believe that business impact is best understood by great data visualization?
We are on a mission to empower people to master new skills and behaviors. We achieve this by creating game changing 3D training solutions founded on the principles of simulation and gamification. We make solutions that generate real world impact!
To enable this mission, we are dedicated to track and visualize the measurable impact for our customers business and organization, whatever the KPIs. And we are now looking to strengthen our team with a Data Engineer to join our Oslo office.

Description:
Heisann!
Liker du å jobbe med teknologi, data og forretning? I Fraktal er vi brennende opptatt av å utvikle gode løsninger som støtter opp om kundens digitale strategi. Vi har betydelige leveranser innenfor datavarehus, datavisualisering, integrasjoner og maskinlæring for store kunder lokalt og nasjonalt. Felles for disse er bruk av nyeste teknologi der vi som leverandør ivaretar flere roller som rådgivere, arkitekter og utviklere.

Nå har vi behov for å styrke laget innenfor dataplattform og søker etter Data Engineer.

Arbeidsoppgaver:

Data Engineer - Oslo
160123_DE_LRW_1673762402
Joining a growing data & analytics department, you will work closely alongside fellow data engineers, scientists and analysts to deliver valuable insights to a tech company developing solutions for the education industry

With multiple offices across Europe, and a Head Office based in Oslo, you will be tasked with helping to create a centralised data platform

With various data sources from schools, universities and academic institutes around the world, and multiple types of data there are plenty of challenges to get in to!

As part of a smaller team with great flexibility, you will have the opportunity to broaden your skillset and gain experience in areas that may interest you, such as datawarehouse design, project leadership, and data science/ML

Your primary goal is to enable teams across the business develop data-driven products and services, and deliver meaningful insights which can help to optimise education programmes and institutes

Your key responsibilities can include:


We are looking for you to have some of the following skills & experiences:


You will be joining an international and informal working environment, where flexibility and functionality are key

Central to the working culture is the work-life balance to ensure you are as productive as can be in a supportive environment.

In practical terms, this means you can work from the office or at home - whatever works for you, and also make good use of flexible working hours to ensure your life outside of work is taken care of too

Collaboration is key - especially in an industry which moves as quickly as data! Regardless of seniority, we encourage everyone to come up with new ideas and be a part of the decision making process - we grow faster together!

For more information or any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@jeffersonfrank.com

Description:
Analytics Engineer. Hva gjør du da?
Du har allerede opparbeidet deg relevant arbeidserfaring som enten Data Developer, Data Engineer, Data Analyst - ja, kjært barn har mange navn. Det viktigste er strengt tatt ikke hvilken rolle du har hatt, men at du blir motivert av uttrykk som: Datavarehus, data pipelines, og SQL. Innehar du en naturlig nysgjerrighet, elsker tall og digger at det er kort vei fra idé til utførelse? Da har vi en unik mulighet for deg!

Description:
Shaping the future of shipping and logistics
We are on a quest to build resilient, decarbonized, and cost-effective supply chains, and are now seeking a Data Engineer to join our Supply Chain Analytics (SCA) team. The team works closely with customers of CargoValue to increase visibility of their supply chain data and provide them with actionable insights to significantly improve their supply chain management.
Together we want to have a positive impact on the world we live in, helping global companies reduce costs, risks and CO2 emissions related to their shipping activities.
Who are we
Klaveness Digital is a Norwegian technology company on a mission to bring shipping and logistics into the future through our SaaS solution, CargoValue. CargoValue is a cloud-based platform that provides industrial companies with a digital twin of their seaborne supply chains, improving supply chain management by delivering real-time visibility, improving transparency, and fostering collaboration between stakeholders involved in the planning, scheduling, and production processes.

Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Principal Software Engineer
Overview:
The Applications team was created to establish Mastercard as the frontrunner in the fast-evolving real-time payments space, and to position MasterCard to be able to incubate the development of new payment flows.
The team is responsible for designing, building, and operating the technology that powers Mastercard’s next generation payment applications – Domestic, Cross Border and Bill Payments.
Mastercard seeks to define a world beyond cash. To accelerate this mission, we are committed to building & scaling products & applications that transform payments of any type. Real time payment technology is central to this strategy. The current consumer bill pay experience is cumbersome, costly, slow and fragmented. We are on a journey to build and scale a world-class bill pay network. By combining our RTP experience with our existing products; BPX, RPPS, Omni Billing, PBA and PBA RFP, as well as other assets, we can bring a solution to market that improves this outdated ecosystem for all parties involved. To win in the market, we will also leverage our strengths in brand, standards, consistency, trust and security. This position will be at the center of growing our applications technology platform and team for Bill Pay.


The Role:
What’s it all about and what we expect you to do day to day

Description:
Gjennom utvikling av nye, datadrevne løsninger ønsker våre kunder å hente ut mer verdi av egne og andres data på en trygg og effektiv måte. Stikkord er god og sikker informasjonsforvaltning med fokus på fangst, lagring, foredling, bruk og formidling av data og innsikt.
Brenner du for utnyttelse av data og ønsker å være med å bygge vår avdeling og satsning på dataplattform og -analyse? Da bør du lese videre!


Hos oss får du:

Med utgangspunkt i kundens behov vil du jobbe med design og implementering av sikre, datadrevne løsninger i ulike konfigurasjoner av skyoppsett (on-prem, private, community, public, hybrid, multicloud). Du vil være den kunnskapsrike navigatøren som loser kunden trygt gjennom reisen.

Data Engineers, Scientists, Analysts - Oslo
301222_DESA_LRW_1672380027
We are looking to grow our data team further, with positions in engineering, science, BI & analytics

Your work will focus on designing and delivering solutions to complex challenges and questions, which can impact everyone in society - bringing insights to healthcare & education provides, energy companies on their 'green transition', and government/public sector organisations.

The solutions you create can have a huge impact on businesses as well as value-adding benefit to the wider public

As an engineer your tasks could involve designing, implementing, monitoring and optimising data platforms to meet requirements - adhering to best practice, and ensuring systems are scalable, robust, and secure

As a scientist, you can focus on developing algorithms and predictive models to give more valuable insights to industry

As part of the BI & analytics team, you will work to provide actionable insights in a clear way for businesses to understand and implement

The team structures are cross-functional to allow for all of the expertise needed across a digitalisation process, you will have seniors and domain experts to learn from, along with juniors to help mentor & guide along the way

We are looking for you to have some of the following skills and experiences:


As part of the team, you will be in a dedicated professional environment built on competence and knowledge sharing
Despite the growth in previous years, the structure has remained flat, and the working culture informal. Each employee is a shareholder and can contribute towards the future journey of the company, no matter how junior or senior!

We have dedicated days throughout the year for self-development and attending courses & conferences, alongside a personal budget which you can use to aid your professional development - whether you choose to become certified, explore a new technology, or attend industry events, it's up to you!

We also value the expertise our own colleagues have, and invite those willing to host professional evenings and networking events to share their knowledge

There are of course non-work related social activities too! With sporting teams including football, kayaking and skiing, as well as more niche social activities to attend such as operas, comedy shows or cooking classes!

There are plenty of challenging and exciting projects to be part of, with great investment in Cloud and data-driven services, and a focus on delivering solutions to those who need it most

If you would like to know more, reach out to Lucy on l.whiting@jeffersonfrank.com

Description:
Job description

The University of Oslo is looking for a Data Scientist with expertise in biodiversity informatics for the HORIZON-INFRA-2021-TECH-01 project "Biodiversity Digital Twin for Advanced Modeling, Simulation, and Prediction Capabilities" (BioDT). The BioDT project is a 36-month (2022-2025) pan-European research infrastructure project coordinated by the CSC IT Center for Science (Espoo, Finland) and includes 22 project partners from across 12 countries.

More about the position

The appointment is a full-time project position until the end of the project in May 2025. The position will be associated with the Norwegian Participant Node (GBIF Norway) of the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) and based at the University of Oslo Natural History Museum in Oslo. The appointed candidate will take part in a multinational team for delivering the responsibilities of UiO for the Horizon Europe-funded Biodiversity Twin (BioDT) project and be responsible for working with biodiversity information standards for the content data streams in collaboration with project partners and international standards bodies. BioDT’s objective is to create a first-in-class digital twin prototype for the advanced modeling and prediction of biodiversity and its patterns. Through practical user cases, it will address critical issues related to global biodiversity dynamics, and support science-based decision-making for the protection and restoration of our earth’s biodiversity.


Capture requirements and coordinate collaboration on data standards from across the research infrastructures (RIs) of GBIF, Distributed System of Scientific Collections (DiSSCo ESFRI), Long-Term Ecosystem Research in Europe (eLTER ESFRI), and the LifeWatch ERIC.
Documenting and communicating data content and data quality requirements, and addressing issues diagnosed in relation to the data standards for ecological data and other data types for the BioDT use cases.
Contribute to the implementation of processes and data flows from environmental databases to ecological models, including data quality and fitness for use checks.
Disseminating captured project requirements and results from the improvement of the data standards at relevant conferences and in peer-reviewed scientific journals.
Interact with task groups of the Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG) community and other relevant stakeholders involved in the development of the biodiversity information standards and vocabularies for the data streams to the BioDT use cases.
Collaborating with other project team members at the GBIF Secretariat to mobilize new data resources through interactions with the biological community. Supporting data publishers, and data users with data standards-related questions.
Supporting the wider network of project partners and collaborators through technical support and training, including a strong communication component (email, video calls, etc.).
Qualification requirements
A Ph.D. or an equivalent doctoral degree in data science, biodiversity informatics, ecoinformatics, natural sciences, or a related field.
Experience with biodiversity informatics, data science, FAIR data principles, open science, persistent identifier technologies, and open data stewardship.
A relevant scientific publication record.
Excellent English language skills (written and spoken).
Desired qualifications and personal qualities
Experience with relevant biodiversity data standards such as Darwin Core, Ecological Metadata Standards (EML), Biological Collections Ontology (BCO), Environment Ontology (EnvO), and/or Minimum Information about any (x) Sequence (MIxS).
Knowledge of the research infrastructures for biodiversity data, including the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF), Long-Term Ecosystem Research in Europe (eLTER), Distributed System of Scientific Collections (DiSSCo), and the LifeWatch ERIC e-Science European infrastructure for biodiversity and ecosystem research.
Experience with relevant data types including species occurrence data, collection specimens, taxonomic data, ecoinformatics, and ecological data.
Teaching experience within data science and/or biodiversity informatics.
Experience with suitable programming languages for data flow and analysis.
Experience with collaboration tools like Git (GitHub) and related solutions.
Demonstrated ability to communicate and work in a distributed team.
Experience with teamwork in an international and multicultural setting.
Scandinavian language skills are an advantage.
We offer
Salary NOK 661 400 - 746 900 per annum depending on qualifications (position code Researcher SKO 1109).
A chance to contribute to building a world-class research infrastructure that is central to the European strategic plans for research, digitization, and the green new deal.
Career building links with a vibrant international research network with excellent opportunities for building a career in data science.
A stimulating and friendly working environment.
Membership in the Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund.
Attractive welfare benefits and a generous pension agreement, in addition to Oslo’s family-friendly environment with its rich opportunities for culture and outdoor activities.
How to apply

The application must include

A cover letter that includes a statement of motivation and a summary of scientific background and research interests.
A CV summarizing education, positions, research profile and merits, pedagogical qualifications, and other qualifying activities.
A list of scientific publications.
Contact information for two reference persons (name, relation to candidate, e-mail, and phone number). No reference letters should be submitted.
The application with attachments must be delivered in our electronic recruiting system.
Please note that all documents should be in English. Interviews will be part of the appointment process.
Formal regulations

According to the Norwegian Freedom of Information Act (Offentleglova) information about the applicant may be included in the public applicant list, also in cases where the applicant has requested non-disclosure.

Inclusion and diversity are a strength. The University of Oslo has a personnel policy objective of achieving a balanced gender composition. Furthermore, we want employees with diverse professional expertise, life experience and perspectives.

If there are qualified applicants with disabilities, employment gaps or immigrant background, we will invite at least one applicant from each of these categories to an interview.

Contact information

Chief engineer Dag Endresen, dag.endresen@nhm.uio.no, +47 40612982, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2352-5497

Research Director Hugo de Boer, h.de.boer@nhm.uio.no, +47 98126030, https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1985-7859

For questions about the recruitment system, please contact HR Officer Thomas Brånå: thomas.brana@nhm.uio.no

About the University of Oslo

The University of Oslo (UiO, https://ror.org/01xtthb56) is Norway’s oldest and highest ranked educational and research institution, with 28 000 students and 7000 employees. With its broad range of academic disciplines and internationally recognised research communities, UiO is an important contributor to society.

The Natural History Museum (UiO-NHMO) has about 200 employees organized into five sections. The section for research and collections has about 97 employees, is organized into nine research groups, and conducts research in biodiversity and evolution. The research covers both biology and geology (incl. paleontology), and the scientific staff is responsible for managing and developing the largest scientific collection in Norway (approx. six million objects). NHM's scientific staff also contributes by teaching and supervising students admitted to various programs at the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences and disseminates research-based knowledge to the public through exhibitions, lectures, and popular science media.

The Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF, https://ror.org/05fjyn938) is an international network and data infrastructure funded by the world’s governments and aimed at providing anyone, anywhere, free and open access to data about all types of life on Earth. The Norwegian Participant node in GBIF (www.gbif.no) is hosted at the UiO-NHMO.

Description:
Data Engineer (Azure) - Oslo
200323_DE_LRW_1679292004
We are looking for a Data Engineer with experience in Azure to join the team in Oslo!

The department is based at intersection between business and technology, where you will work alongside fellow data engineers, as well as analysts and advisors within business & data strategy

Some of your key responsibilities can include:

Building data products & services, and integrating these into systems and business processes

Some of the technologies you will work with include: Azure Databricks, Data Factory, Logic Apps, SQL, Power BI

We are looking for you to have at least 3 years of professional experience within data engineering, you should be competent with ETL processes and tools, and have worked with Microsoft Azure

We hope you are proficient in SQL, and perhaps familiar with Python with experience building data pipelines

You should have some experience with data visualisation and Power BI, and be familiar with the requirements of data analysts and scientists

As part of a cross-functional team, we hope that you can bring a curiosity and motivation to build quality, scalable and flexible data infrastructure & processes to assist the organisation and it's customers in becoming more data driven

A strong academic background in IT/Engineering is nice to have, along with certifications, but equivalent years of experience can compensate

What's in it for you?

Among the benefits on offer, you can expect:

A flexible working environment with options to start your day earlier or finish later depending on your schedule outside of work. There is a hybrid office/home set-up with most colleagues attending the office two days per week

Enhanced pension and health insurances for your peace of mind, along with all of the equipment required for your role

There is time for you to learn new tools and technologies which interest you, as well as explore new project areas which appeal to you

As a team of 20 within business & data, you can expect freedom and ownership over your tasks along with little bureaucracy to see your ideas turn into action quickly

You will be part of a diverse team from a range of backgrounds, including senior colleagues to share responsibilities with, and more junior members to mentor

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@jeffersonfrank.com

Description:
Company Overview
At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety.Its the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.

As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.

At Motorola Solutions, were ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.

Department Overview The System Integration Field Engineering organization is part of the postsales International Markets organization within Motorola Solutions. This team is responsible for the project implementation and functional testing of government and commercial communications system solutions, leveraging new technologies and approaches sourced from both inside and outside of Motorola Solutions. Typical systems and products include Communications Control Centers, Wireless Data and Voice Systems, Signaling and Remote Control Systems, Broadband Wireless Systems, and Public Safety Applications.
Job Description
The Field Engineering role forms part of multidisciplined project teams to design and deliver complex mission critical voice and data systems. The systems may be used directly by our customers or by Motorola Solutions to deliver Managed Services to our customers. The Field Engineers work in the post sales phases of projects and may support multiple projects in a given period depending on size and complexity. There may also be a requirement to provide support to Presales and Services Organization.

The key responsibilities of the System Integration Field Engineer

Manage andor perform implementation of communication system solutions and services which satisfy the requirements of the customer, end user and operator

Provides technical support for Solution Staging, as required

Lead or participate in Factory Acceptance Test FAT while coordinating the technical aspects of the acceptance testing.

Responsible for the installation, integration, testing, and commissioning of MSI and 3rd party solutions with support from suppliervendor

Responsible for identifying, investigating and troubleshooting of technical issues during project implementation

Responsible for onsite Acceptance Tests, while coordinating the technical aspects of the acceptance testing.

Update of technical documentation and technical change management

Provide technical support during all project phases through to handover to Support organisation

Communications Attend customer meetings, status updates, provide project reporting.

Provide onsite or remote support to the customers and partners

Responsible for self development through an agreed training plan,experience and knowledge transfer.

Leading the field deployment and daytoday activities Deploying, Configuring, commissioning, Testing and troubleshooting systems and solutions.

Identifies and mitigates technical risks; develops and implements risk mitigation plans and recommends corrective actions.

Interface, communicate, and coordinate the customer, partner, subcontractor on project deployment and best practices where required.

Ensure the project is delivered to the Motorola Solutions Quality, Health and Safety standards.

Conducts technical implementation assessments directly with end users and project team.

Basic Requirements
The key qualifications of the System Integration Field Engineer

Fluent inEnglish and Norwegian.

University degree or equivalent educationin one of the following faculties Electronic and Telecommunication Engineering; Telecommunication Engineering; Electronic Engineering; Network Engineering; Computer Systems Engineering; Electro technology Engineering

At least 543; year professional experience in the area, e.g. Computer System and Network Engineer, Telecommunications Engineer, Field Network Engineer, Field Service Engineer, Customer Support Engineer;

Manual skills for field works like wiring, soldering, physical installation of equipment in addition to commissioning and testing tasks.

Valid Driving license

Availability and willingness to travel 5075, inside and outside residence country;

Willingness to obtain relevant Security Clearance to enter customer site.

Experience in one or more of the following would be advantageous

TCPIP, Radio Communication Systems, Command and Control Systems, Local and Wide Area Networks,Networking Protocols, Technical Analysis and Problem Troubleshooting;

Specific experience in Motorola technology as DIMETRA and MOTOTRBO Capacity Max and WAVEKodiak and further experience in NICE Voice Logging technology would be advantageous.

Travel Requirements 5075
Relocation Provided None
Position Type Experienced

Referral Payment Plan Yes

Description:

Whether you join us in Oslo or Sandefjord, you’ll be joining a friendly team that supports one another and always takes the opportunity to have fun along the way.

Become part of Europe’s leading tech company – Make progress happen

You must love to help team members and to receive help from them. The team is international so you will use English both written and orally.

Upgrade network equipments with new software release

Description:
Ønsker du å jobbe med Data Engineering i landets sterkeste fagmiljø?
BearingPoint er Norges sterkeste fagmiljø innen data og analyse og har drevet med dette i over 20 år. Teamet vårt i Oslo har nærmere 70 ansatte som jobber rendyrket med Data & Analytics. Vi har en unik dybde og bredde innenfor data og analyse, med solid erfaring innen alle våre fire tjenesteområder: Data Engineering, Data Science, Data Advisory og Data Governance. Nå ser vi etter flere Data Engineers som ønsker å være med på å ta vårt allerede ledende fagmiljø til nye høyder. Dersom du synes dette høres spennende ut, anbefaler vi deg å lese videre!

Vi er leverandøruavhengige og leverer Data & Analytics-løsninger på Azure, AWS, GCP og on-prem-teknologier, hos alt fra start-ups til Norges største selskaper. Vi bygger fleksible og samtidig robuste dataplattformer, basert på moderne teknologi og arkitekturprinsipper. Vi har et mantra om alltid å fokusere på realisert verdi, og alle våre prosjekter er forankret i tydelige forretningsmål. Vi leverer verdi raskt ved å implementere konkrete verdiforslag ende til ende iterativt, heller enn å bygge omfattende løsninger etter vannfallsmetoden.

Description:
Elliptic Labs is looking for a Machine-Learning Automation Engineer to join our Machine Learning & Algorithm team. You’ll be instrumental in designing and maintaining an advanced ground-truth-tagging system for machine-learning data collection. We love automating tasks so that we can scale our product portfolio as fast as possible.
Primary Responsibilities
Research and development of automatic ground-truth-tagging systems of human presence and gestures
Gesture recognition based on computer vision, radar, lidar, IR etc.
A depth camera system for automatic ground-truth tagging of humans and hand gestures
Customize and improve efficiency in our pipelines to reduce time to market

Vi har de siste årene bygget et sterkt fagmiljø i Aztek som brenner for ende-til-ende implementasjon av maskinlæring og analyse. Dette ønsker vi å ytterligere forsterke og du vil få en sentral rolle i den videre utviklingen av avdelingen og vår satsning på dataplattform og -analyse.

Description:
Summary
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.
We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

Description:
Nel Hydrogen Electrolyser are now looking for a Technologist – Process Engineer
Nel is a global, dedicated hydrogen company that delivers optimal solutions for producing, storing and distributing hydrogen from renewable energy. We serve industries, energy and gas companies with leading hydrogen technology. Since its foundation in 1927, Nel has a proud history of developing and continuously improving hydrogen plants. Our hydrogen solutions cover the entire value chain from hydrogen production technologies to the production of hydrogen stations, and provide all fuel cell electric vehicles with the same fast fuel and long range as conventional vehicles today. At Nel, our vision is about "empowering generations with clean energy forever". Our technology enables people and businesses to make daily use of hydrogen, the most abundant element in the universe.
Nel's technology department develops the next generation of technologies and products to support Nel's future business plans. The department has a global footprint with personnel and laboratory infrastructure in Norway, Denmark and the US. Important development areas include alkaline and PEM electrolysers and hydrogen fueling stations, both current and new technologies. Green hydrogen has been identified as one of the most important factors in supporting the reduction of CO2 emissions from traditional industry and transport. Development of new technologies and products adapted to operation with renewable energy such as wind and solar is seen as crucial to support the growth of the green hydrogen industry.

About EVBox
EVBox is the leading global manufacturer of electric vehicle charging stations and charging management software. With over 350,000 charging points across more than 55 countries worldwide, we help electric drivers get access to charging infrastructure at any point in their journey.
Today, with many projects running across Europe, North America, South America, and Asia, we move forward by perfecting our original recipe with a next generation of hardware and software that is energy-efficient, future-proof, and easy to use.
The growth and success of EVBox is driven by the passion and dedication of everyone in the company.
EVBox has grown into an international team across multiple offices in Europe and the United States. Today, over 600 driven professionals coming from different walks of life are working for EVBox. As a fast-growing scale-up within the beating heart of the clean tech industry.

Description:
Ønsker du å jobbe med Data Science i Norges sterkeste fagmiljø?

BearingPoints Data & Analytics-team er best i Norge på Data Engineering og Data Science. Teamet vårt i Oslo har nærmere 70 ansatte som jobber rendyrket med Data & Analytics. Vi har en unik dybde og bredde innenfor data og analyse, med solid erfaring innen alle våre fire tjenesteområder: Data Engineering, Data Science, Data Advisory og Data Governance. Nå ser vi etter flere Data Scientists som ønsker å være med på å ta vårt allerede ledende fagmiljø til nye høyder. Dersom du synes dette høres spennende ut, anbefaler vi deg å lese videre!
Bedrifter velger BearingPoint når de trenger noe mer enn noen som løser enkeltoppgaver. Vi tenker helhetlig, utfordrer våre kunder og sørger alltid for å levere verdi heller enn blindt å løse oppgaver vi blir tildelt. Vi har et mantra om alltid å fokusere på realisert verdi og alle våre prosjekter er forankret i konkrete forretningsmål. Innen Data Science fortsetter vi å utvide horisonten vår innen ML og har blant annet opprettet faggrupper innen Natural Language Processing (NLP) og Computer Vision. Vi er leverandøruavhengige og bygger for det meste modeller selv i Python som vi operasjonaliserer i skymiljøer.

Description:
Why TI?
Engineer your future. We empower our employees to truly own their career and development. Come collaborate with some of the smartest people in the world to shape the future of electronics.
We're different by design. Diverse backgrounds and perspectives are what push innovation forward and what make TI stronger. We value each and every voice, and look forward to hearing yours. Meet the people of TI
Benefits that benefit you. We offer competitive pay and benefits designed to help you and your family live your best life. Your well-being is important to us.

About Texas Instruments
As a global semiconductor company, we design, manufacture, test and sell analog and embedded processing chips to nearly 100,000 customers. Our products enable electronics everywhere and in things you experience every day - from health care, smart homes and connected cars to drones, smart phones and more. Our passion to create a better and more sustainable world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors drives us to make our technology smaller, more efficient, more reliable and more affordable.

Description:
Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Yugabyte, Spark and Kafka, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis, MongoDB and Opensearch, all the way to structured SQL engines like PostgreSQL and MySQL.
This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about delivering high quality, reliable and automated infrastructure based on open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.
Experience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technologies.

Nel is a global, dedicated hydrogen company that delivers optimal solutions for producing, storing and distributing hydrogen from renewable energy. We serve industries, energy and gas companies with leading hydrogen technology. Since its foundation in 1927, Nel has a proud history of developing and continuously improving hydrogen plants. Our hydrogen solutions cover the entire value chain from hydrogen production technologies to the production of hydrogen stations, and provide all fuel cell electric vehicles with the same fast fuel and long range as conventional vehicles today. At Nel, our vision is about "empowering generations with clean energy forever". Our technology enables people and businesses to make daily use of hydrogen, the most abundant element in the universe.
Nel's technology department develops the next generation of technologies and products to support Nel's future business plans. The department has a global footprint with personnel and laboratory infrastructure in Norway, Denmark and the US. Important development areas include alkaline and PEM electrolysers and hydrogen fueling stations, both current and new technologies. Green hydrogen has been identified as one of the most important factors in supporting the reduction of CO2 emissions from traditional industry and transport. Development of new technologies and products adapted to operation with renewable energy such as wind and solar is seen as crucial to support the growth of the green hydrogen industry.

Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?

We are changemakers and problem solvers with more than 180 years of experience. Our ambitions are high. Description:
Cognite IT is dedicated to finding more sustainable, scalable, simple, and secure solutions, as we are growing rapidly, spreading to the US, Japan, and Asia. We hope you want to join our team and implement better solutions for our future growth as Cognite's managed client expert with Azure experience!

As our new IT Operations Cloud Engineer, you will work with Cognite IT Operations Engineers to manage, maintain and develop Cognite's global mobile device management and Azure-based solutions. You will redesign, secure, and manage the MDM (MAC, Windows, IOS, Android, and Chrome OS) platform, based on Jamf, Azure, and M365.

Furthermore, you will provide higher-tier expertise / support in Azure solutions based on the requirement of security frameworks, which can be applied to sandbox solutions in Azure, such as VDIs, etc.

, we believe you are highly motivated, proactive, and solution-oriented, with excellent troubleshooting skills. We believe that proactively seeking ways to help others and understanding their needs are qualities that define you. Furthermore, you are a team player that is both expert in these areas, but also a collaborator with a team-building attitude.

Description:
We’re growing our team in Sandefjord, and are looking for a new Senior Software Engineer! You’ll be joining our X-file team; a team dedicated to problem solving, that collaborates closely with other Development teams, Support, Cloud Delivery and Technical Consulting. Read on to find out more, and apply!

What you’ll do as Senior Software Engineer:
Take part in solving the mysteries of X-files, related to issues that happen at customers end - hidden in code or data, or a combination
Proactively lead the way in building the future toolbox for problem solving

About EVBox
EVBox is the leading global manufacturer of electric vehicle charging stations and charging management software. With over 350,000 charging points across more than 55 countries worldwide, we help electric drivers get access to charging infrastructure at any point in their journey.
Today, with many projects running across Europe, North America, South America, and Asia, we move forward by perfecting our original recipe with a next generation of hardware and software that is energy-efficient, future-proof, and easy to use.
The growth and success of EVBox is driven by the passion and dedication of everyone in the company.
EVBox has grown into an international team across multiple offices in Europe and the United States. Today, over 600 driven professionals coming from different walks of life are working for EVBox. As a fast-growing scale-up within the beating heart of the clean tech industry.

Description:
Everbridge: a fast-growing global provider of SaaS-based critical communications and enterprise safety solutions are currently seeking a Norwegian speaking Technical Support Engineer (TSE). This role can be office based (hybrid) in Oslo or homebased anywhere in Norway.

About Everbridge
Everbridge is the Global leader in Public Warning that automates and accelerates a government or agency’s operational response to critical events to keep people safe, assets protected and provide guidance for safety. Headquartered in the United States, with operations in Europe, India, APAC, Latin America, United Kingdom, our team of 2000+ dedicated employees support over 6000 global customers every day in their most crucial moments. During public safety threats such as Earthquakes, Tsunami’s, Floods, Fires as well as active assailant, terrorist attack or missing persons, Governments and agencies rely on our Public Warning platform to alert their citizens at risk quickly and reliably, automate the execution of pre-defined communications processes, and track progress on executing response plans.

Description: The AI/HPC System Engineering team is looking for a Hardware System Design Engineer to design, implement, grow, and maintain the proof of concept development, test, and emulation platforms for Meta's AI/HPC comprised of cutting-edge accelerator, bus and network technologies. This team is working on the design, implementation, and support of one of the world’s largest AI/HPC deployments. In this role, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the future AI/HPC of Meta by specifying technical requirements and steering the industry and ecosystem.This role will be working across many projects in our AI/HPC System team to shape our system design and development requirements across Hardware projects. A successful candidate will be a HW system and platform builder, equally comfortable working on boards, sensors, FPGA RTL design/verification, performance and power test and evaluation, OS/RTOS kernel and driver software and architectures. The position requires a developer, able to debug and extract solutions from vague descriptions of system architecture and workloads, who also builds cross functional relationships across teams to find ideas, assets and assistance to explore faster.

Description:
Here at Asolvi, we are looking for an IT Help Desk Technician who is resourceful, knowledgeable, helpful, and cooperative, supporting our users daily and to participate in company-wide IT functions and projects. This role will be focused on ensuring that our desktop and office systems - including computers, company systems, and online services - are working correctly and efficiently.

A primary responsibility of the role is to provide operational and technical support to identify, investigate, and resolve problems, manage hardware and software assets, and technical onboarding and offboarding of employees.

This role will require excellent communication skills, as well as a natural ability to teach and explain concepts coherently, both verbally and in writing, to a diverse workforce. In addition to a broad knowledge of technologies, you have the skills necessary to create guidance and how-tos, and document common fixes concisely. Your multitasking skills, ability to work independently, and ability to navigate a fast-paced environment are important to us.

Description:
Nel Hydrogen Electrolyser are now looking for Technologist - Simulation/digitalization
Nel is a global, dedicated hydrogen company that delivers optimal solutions for producing, storing and distributing hydrogen from renewable energy. We serve industries, energy and gas companies with leading hydrogen technology. Since its foundation in 1927, Nel has a proud history of developing and continuously improving hydrogen plants. Our hydrogen solutions cover the entire value chain from hydrogen production technologies to the production of hydrogen stations, and provide all fuel cell electric vehicles with the same fast fuel and long range as conventional vehicles today. At Nel, our vision is about "empowering generations with clean energy forever". Our technology enables people and businesses to make daily use of hydrogen, the most abundant element in the universe.
Nel's technology department develops the next generation of technologies and products to support Nel's future business plans. The department has a global footprint with personnel and laboratory infrastructure in Norway, Denmark and the US. Important development areas include alkaline and PEM electrolysers and hydrogen fueling stations, both current and new technologies. Green hydrogen has been identified as one of the most important factors in supporting the reduction of CO2 emissions from traditional industry and transport. Development of new technologies and products adapted to operation with renewable energy such as wind and solar is seen as crucial to support the growth of the green hydrogen industry.

Why TI?
Engineer your future. We empower our employees to truly own their career and development. Come collaborate with some of the smartest people in the world to shape the future of electronics.
We're different by design. Diverse backgrounds and perspectives are what push innovation forward and what make TI stronger. We value each and every voice, and look forward to hearing yours. Meet the people of TI
Benefits that benefit you. We offer competitive pay and benefits designed to help you and your family live your best life. Your well-being is important to us.

About Texas Instruments
As a global semiconductor company, we design, manufacture, test and sell analog and embedded processing chips to nearly 100,000 customers. Our products enable electronics everywhere and in things you experience every day - from health care, smart homes and connected cars to drones, smart phones and more. Our passion to create a better and more sustainable world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors drives us to make our technology smaller, more efficient, more reliable and more affordable.

Description:
Do you want to play a senior role in the development of new technology for a global leader within its field? Are you a technologist with expertise within controls/cybernetics who would like to work with product development from idea to final test and delivery? At our Technology and Innovation Centre, we can offer you a collaborative community that focuses on personal development, opportunities and growth.
Shearwater is a global provider of powerful geophysical marine seismic acquisition and processing services from sensor to image. The company is, by asset, the leading marine seismic acquisition company globally. Core activities include data acquisition, software processing and imaging, and technology and innovation.
The Technology and Innovation Centre`s activities are to develop, produce and test state of the art products for geophysical applications within oil & gas, carbon capture and storage, and renewable energy industries. The centre and its people have proven the ability to bring revolutionary ideas to fruition. The centre is a scientific community that attracts highly skilled technologists who get to use their passion for developing new ideas and technology in close collaboration with key clients, research and technology partners and academia.

Job_title: Golang System Software Engineer - Containers / Virtualisation
Description:
We are hiring a Golang software engineer to work on the low level Go codebase sitting between our REST API and the low level C libraries used to manage containers and virtual machines. We are looking for system-level developers with experience in design and data management/modeling.
The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.
This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.

At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future. Description:
Elliptic Labs is looking for an Machine-Learning Ops Engineer to join our Machine Learning & Algorithm team. You’ll be building and maintaining our infrastructure for monitoring and training machine-learning models. Our goal is to build simple, yet powerful automated tools.
Primary Responsibilities
Maximize the efficiency and reliability of our ML pipeline (data collection, tagging, preprocessing, training, and testing)
Supervise software builds and deployment pipelines for continuous delivery

Desired Skills and Experience

Vil du bli en del av et av Nordens ledende data- og innsiktsmiljø?
Vi opplever høy etterspørsel etter våre tjenester og ser etter erfarne Data Engineers for å styrke forretningsenheten Insights & Data i Bergen. Vi ser etter deg som har stor interesse for data, innsikt og analyse, og som ønsker å ta steget videre i din karriere gjennom ledende prosjektroller.
Insights & Data er et av Nordens største og ledende fagmiljø innen moderne data- og innsiktsplattformer. Vi leverer tjenester innenfor Analytics, Data Engineering, Arkitektur, Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Master Data Management (MDM) og Data Governance. Job_title: Customer Success Manager - Enterprise Data Solutions
Description:
About The Job
Customer Success Managers (CSMs) connect our clients to LSEG/Refinitiv’s Enterprise solutions.
The successful CSM, for which this advert is crafted, is part of an international team in EMEA with a breakdown to Nordics & Benelux.
The main region to work with are countries in the Nordics. The CSMs in our team are trusted advisors to their client base and combine relationship management, education, and functional expertise to drive adoption, retention, and growth within their assigned account portfolio.
To achieve this, a Customer Success Manager at LSEG/Refinitiv collaborates with internal teams & roles (Account Managers, Sales Specialists, Customer Support of various levels, data teams, administrative functions, Product & Programme management, Developer Advocates, Solutions Consultants & fellow CSMs).
A multitude of working groups and learning opportunities help our CSMs to ensure their customers fully demonstrate the value of LSEG/Refinitiv within their financial data workflows.

Description: The AI/HPC System Engineering team is looking for a Hardware System Design Engineer to design, implement, grow, and maintain the proof of concept development, test, and emulation platforms for Meta's AI/HPC comprised of cutting-edge accelerator, bus and network technologies. This team is working on the design, implementation, and support of one of the world’s largest AI/HPC deployments. In this role, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the future AI/HPC of Meta by specifying technical requirements and steering the industry and ecosystem.This role will be working across many projects in our AI/HPC System team to shape our system design and development requirements across Hardware projects. A successful candidate will be a HW system and platform builder, equally comfortable working on boards, sensors, FPGA RTL design/verification, performance and power test and evaluation, OS/RTOS kernel and driver software and architectures. The position requires a developer, able to debug and extract solutions from vague descriptions of system architecture and workloads, who also builds cross functional relationships across teams to find ideas, assets and assistance to explore faster.

Job_title: Golang System Software Engineer - Containers / Virtualisation
Description:
We are hiring a Golang software engineer to work on the low level Go codebase sitting between our REST API and the low level C libraries used to manage containers and virtual machines. We are looking for system-level developers with experience in design and data management/modeling.
The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.
This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.

24M Technologies answers the world’s need for affordable energy storage by enabling a new, more cost-effective solution — SemiSolidTM lithium-ion technology. Description:
Nel Hydrogen Electrolyser are now looking for Technologist - Simulation/digitalization
Nel is a global, dedicated hydrogen company that delivers optimal solutions for producing, storing and distributing hydrogen from renewable energy. We serve industries, energy and gas companies with leading hydrogen technology. Since its foundation in 1927, Nel has a proud history of developing and continuously improving hydrogen plants. Our hydrogen solutions cover the entire value chain from hydrogen production technologies to the production of hydrogen stations, and provide all fuel cell electric vehicles with the same fast fuel and long range as conventional vehicles today. At Nel, our vision is about "empowering generations with clean energy forever". Our technology enables people and businesses to make daily use of hydrogen, the most abundant element in the universe.
Nel's technology department develops the next generation of technologies and products to support Nel's future business plans. The department has a global footprint with personnel and laboratory infrastructure in Norway, Denmark and the US. Important development areas include alkaline and PEM electrolysers and hydrogen fueling stations, both current and new technologies. Green hydrogen has been identified as one of the most important factors in supporting the reduction of CO2 emissions from traditional industry and transport. Development of new technologies and products adapted to operation with renewable energy such as wind and solar is seen as crucial to support the growth of the green hydrogen industry.

Drive the future of collaborative open source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.
Launchpad is a platform for managing open source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.
Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). You'll be striking a balance between keeping our business-critical services running and expanding our feature set: among other things, we are currently working on expanding our package building capabilities, improving the development flows provided to our users, and modernising our web UI. If you love keeping large projects well-organised and well-maintained, care about supporting developers, and believe that continuous improvement is the key to innovation, higher velocity, and reliability, you'll fit right in.

The Ubuntu MAAS team is responsible for delivering our Metal As A Service hyperscale provisioning technology. Ubuntu strives to be the most scalable, cloud ready server distribution and MAAS is our platform to get it there. MAAS is a rapidly evolving software stack written in Python and Go, and we are looking for experienced software engineers who understand performance at scale, networking, storage and usability.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of Ubuntu and be able to show technical leadership with a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. This position requires international travel several times a year.

Job_title: NORDIC AVANADE TRAINEE PROGRAM 2023 – Software Engineering – Avanade Norway
Description:
Nyutdannet Software Engineer 2023

Avanade er en verdensledende leverandr av konsulenttjenester, med nrmere 60.000 ansatte i 26 land. Selskapet eies av Accenture og Microsoft. Vårt fokus er digital transformasjon av de strste virksomhetene, både i Norge og internasjonalt. Felles for oss alle er en ekteflt lidenskap for innovasjon og teknologi, og et genuint nske om å utvikle forretningskritiske lsninger som forbedrer hverdagen til våre kunder. Vårt tette samarbeid med Microsoft og Accenture, og vår globale leveransemodell gjr oss unike i markedet. I lpet av et år leverer vi mer enn 1000 prosjekter globalt, og vi tilbyr våre konsulenter muligheter for karriereutvikling både i Norge og internasjonalt.

Hvorfor velge vårt Nordiske Trainee program? Fordi her får du muligheten til å gjre teori om til praksis etter endt studietid!

I Avanade er forretning og teknologirådgivning ikke bare vår karriere, men vår store lidenskap. Som Trainee hos oss kommer vi til å hjelpe deg med din karrierestart innen teknologi. For oss betyr det mer enn bare å jobbe med ny innovasjon - det betyr å bruke teknologi for å lse forretningsutfordringer på måter som utgjr en reell forskjell for oss, våre kunder, og samfunnet. Hvis du har en genuin interesse for teknologi og lsningsutvikling, kan Avanade tilby deg et 5 måneders langt Trainee program som samkjres på tverrs av de nordiske landene. Du vil ansettes på ordinre vilkår men få mulighet til å kombinere praktisk training og virkelige kundeprosjekter de frste 5 månedene.

Du vil vre omringet av flotte og kunnskapsrike kolleger, og derfor ha muligheten til å bygge og utvide ditt nettverk lokalt, på et nordisk nivå og globalt. Du vil arbeide med hyt kvalifiserte Microsoft-eksperter, bli trent profesjonelt og vre en del av teamet som hjelper våre kunder med å oppnå resultatene i et milj der folk blir inspirert til å vre sitt beste.

Du vil ta kurs, bli introdusert til vår virksomhet og våre prosesser. Du får din egen karriererådgiver som kan hjelpe deg med alt du trenger for å lykkes i Avanade.

En helt vanlig dag på jobb med Software Engineering teamet hos Avanade vil du blant annet jobbe med:
Kjenner du deg igjen i beskrivelsen?


Snart ferdig utdannet og leter etter drmmejobben? Her er din sjanse!

Utgjr en forskjell fra frste dag! I Avanade favner vi bredt, kom som du er. Ta med dine beste egenskaper, kunnskap og vilje til fortsatt utvikling og vi vil investere i din lring, personlige vekst og karriere. Vi i Avanade har fokus på mangfold og inkludering og nsker å ke kvinneandelen i IT-bransjen. Derfor oppfordrer vi kvinner til å ske.

Ble du interessert?

Sk i dag!

Sknader behandles fortlpende.

The AI/HPC System Engineering team is looking for a Hardware System Design Engineer to design, implement, grow, and maintain the proof of concept development, test, and emulation platforms for Meta's AI/HPC comprised of cutting-edge accelerator, bus and network technologies. This team is working on the design, implementation, and support of one of the world’s largest AI/HPC deployments. In this role, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the future AI/HPC of Meta by specifying technical requirements and steering the industry and ecosystem.This role will be working across many projects in our AI/HPC System team to shape our system design and development requirements across Hardware projects. A successful candidate will be a HW system and platform builder, equally comfortable working on boards, sensors, FPGA RTL design/verification, performance and power test and evaluation, OS/RTOS kernel and driver software and architectures. The position requires a developer, able to debug and extract solutions from vague descriptions of system architecture and workloads, who also builds cross functional relationships across teams to find ideas, assets and assistance to explore faster.

Description:
Drive the future of collaborative open source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.
Launchpad is a platform for managing open source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.
Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). You'll be striking a balance between keeping our business-critical services running and expanding our feature set: among other things, we are currently working on expanding our package building capabilities, improving the development flows provided to our users, and modernising our web UI. If you love keeping large projects well-organised and well-maintained, care about supporting developers, and believe that continuous improvement is the key to innovation, higher velocity, and reliability, you'll fit right in.

Job_title: Lead Software Engineer, Global Bill Pay
Description:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Lead Software Engineer, Global Bill Pay
We are searching for a hands-on lead developer to contribute as a member of a core team within our Global BillPay product. In this role, you’ll be a part of a high priority growth area working with an experienced group of technologists in Oslo and globally.

Our Oslo office has 100+ skilled engineers working on payment applications used both nationally and internationally, forming part of an open and sharing community that supports your own development.

In addition to your technical skills you should have a passion for understanding customer needs to drive real outcomes that propel us forwards, as well as the desire to mentor junior team members.

Your professional qualifications include 7+ years of relevant experience, with knowledge of our tech stack including:

Description:
One Player Mission are excited to be working with a studio that has been laser-focused on its mission to converge the strengths of the games and TV industries to build an entirely new category: hybrid games.
They are seeking a highly skilled and experienced back-end Software Engineer to join their team in the games industry, with a focus on scalability. The back-end Software Engineer will be responsible for designing and implementing the server-side logic and infrastructure that supports the development and operation of games, with a particular emphasis on ensuring that the systems are able to scale to support millions of live active players.
This role will involve working closely with game developers, operations teams, and other stakeholders to ensure that the back-end systems are reliable, scalable, and efficient.

CAF aims to be an employer of choice for people from different backgrounds and to promote respect for everyone through equality of opportunity.
