Job_title: NORDIC AVANADE TRAINEE PROGRAM 2023 – Software Engineering – Avanade Norway
Description:
Nyutdannet Software Engineer 2023

Avanade er en verdensledende leverandr av konsulenttjenester, med nrmere 60.000 ansatte i 26 land. Selskapet eies av Accenture og Microsoft. Vårt fokus er digital transformasjon av de strste virksomhetene, både i Norge og internasjonalt. Felles for oss alle er en ekteflt lidenskap for innovasjon og teknologi, og et genuint nske om å utvikle forretningskritiske lsninger som forbedrer hverdagen til våre kunder. Vårt tette samarbeid med Microsoft og Accenture, og vår globale leveransemodell gjr oss unike i markedet. I lpet av et år leverer vi mer enn 1000 prosjekter globalt, og vi tilbyr våre konsulenter muligheter for karriereutvikling både i Norge og internasjonalt.

Hvorfor velge vårt Nordiske Trainee program? Fordi her får du muligheten til å gjre teori om til praksis etter endt studietid!

I Avanade er forretning og teknologirådgivning ikke bare vår karriere, men vår store lidenskap. Som Trainee hos oss kommer vi til å hjelpe deg med din karrierestart innen teknologi. For oss betyr det mer enn bare å jobbe med ny innovasjon - det betyr å bruke teknologi for å lse forretningsutfordringer på måter som utgjr en reell forskjell for oss, våre kunder, og samfunnet. Hvis du har en genuin interesse for teknologi og lsningsutvikling, kan Avanade tilby deg et 5 måneders langt Trainee program som samkjres på tverrs av de nordiske landene. Du vil ansettes på ordinre vilkår men få mulighet til å kombinere praktisk training og virkelige kundeprosjekter de frste 5 månedene.

Du vil vre omringet av flotte og kunnskapsrike kolleger, og derfor ha muligheten til å bygge og utvide ditt nettverk lokalt, på et nordisk nivå og globalt. Du vil arbeide med hyt kvalifiserte Microsoft-eksperter, bli trent profesjonelt og vre en del av teamet som hjelper våre kunder med å oppnå resultatene i et milj der folk blir inspirert til å vre sitt beste.

Du vil ta kurs, bli introdusert til vår virksomhet og våre prosesser. Du får din egen karriererådgiver som kan hjelpe deg med alt du trenger for å lykkes i Avanade.

En helt vanlig dag på jobb med Software Engineering teamet hos Avanade vil du blant annet jobbe med:
Kjenner du deg igjen i beskrivelsen?


Snart ferdig utdannet og leter etter drmmejobben? Her er din sjanse!

Utgjr en forskjell fra frste dag! I Avanade favner vi bredt, kom som du er. Ta med dine beste egenskaper, kunnskap og vilje til fortsatt utvikling og vi vil investere i din lring, personlige vekst og karriere. Vi i Avanade har fokus på mangfold og inkludering og nsker å ke kvinneandelen i IT-bransjen. Derfor oppfordrer vi kvinner til å ske.

Ble du interessert?

Sk i dag!

Sknader behandles fortlpende.

Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and building technology for democratization of Data Centers. Help us build the #1 bare metal cloud system, and work with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical!
The Ubuntu MAAS team is responsible for delivering our Metal As A Service hyperscale provisioning technology. Ubuntu strives to be the most scalable, cloud ready server distribution and MAAS is our platform to get it there. MAAS is a rapidly evolving software stack written in Python and Go, and we are looking for experienced software engineers who understand performance at scale, networking, storage and usability.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of Ubuntu and be able to show technical leadership with a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. This position requires international travel several times a year.

Description:
Canonical is seeking an experienced Python developer to build the world's best open-source portfolio of integrated, secure and reliable software for the telecommunications industry. Work with upstream open source projects, alongside internal teams to deliver high-quality software that can be deployed on bare metal, public cloud and Kubernetes.
Bring your experience with Python, Linux, Kubernetes and Telecommunications software to help us transform the future of network automation.
Help the growing engineering team at Canonical bring the cutting edge of open-source software into the telecommunications sector. As an engineer on the team, you'll bring significant software development experience, public cloud and Kubernetes experience and a keen eye for software design and architecture.
You will be involved in all the aspects of the software development process: you will design software, write high-quality code and tests, provide insightful code reviews, write documentation and help to troubleshoot issues.

Company_name: Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace - Integrated Defence Systems
Description:
Integrated Defence Systems (IDS) er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace. Vi utvikler og leverer avanserte og teknologisk ledende kommando-, kontroll-, og kommunikasjonsløsninger til forsvarskunder nasjonalt og internasjonalt. Hovedprodukter er NASAMS luftvernsystem og forsvarssystem til ubåt og overflatefartøy.
Integrated Defence Systems (IDS) divisjonen er i sterk vekst og vi leter etter både nyutdannede og erfarne ingeniører! Vår spesialitet er systemintegrasjon, datadrevne operasjoner og beslutningsstøtte. Vi samarbeider med anerkjente bedrifter for å utvikle morgendagens forsvarssystemer. Noe av det vi jobber med er den nye norske ubåten, luftvernsystemet NASAMS, nye stridsvogner til Norge. Vi leter etter deg som brenner for teknologi og vil være med på utvikle noen av de mest komplekse systemløsningene i verden. Vi håper du tar utfordringen ved å søke jobb hos oss!

We offer job opportunities in Norway and abroad, competitive terms and a professional marketing apparatus with good follow-up.
Our projects are within Clean Technology with focus on battery, offshore wind and hydrogen. In addition we deliver to industries such as Oil & Gas, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Banking & Financial Services, Aerospace & Defence, Automotive & Transportation, Manufacturing & Logistics, Information & Communication Technology.
“Engineering a Smarter Future Together”






Bachelor, Master Degree or relevant technical education
Ex course (max 5 years old)
FSE course


Minimum 6 years’ experience from relevant design activities in oil and gas
Experience and deep knowledge of telecom design according to relevant standards such as
NORSOK, ATEX, PTIL, DNVGL and IEC
Required Qualifications:
Have good communication skills
Have a cooperative working attitude and acceptance for multicultural team environment
Ability to work independently as well as in team
Be systematic and accurate
Have a high loyalty to deadline and quality requirements
Be proactive, seeking advice and share own experiences with others
Fluent English and preferably Norwegian skills - both orally and in writing
Required Certificates

Planned start date: 01.03.23
Planned end date: 31.12.25

What you will do
Do you want to use your skills and experience in frontend development to contribute to the global renewable energy transition? Our cloud platform is used by the largest renewable energy companies and manufacturers in the world to develop, construct and operate wind farms across the globe.

You will work in an agile environment where you will be involved in different aspects of our development: analysis, design, implementation, automated testing, code reviews and feature testing.

You will be a part of our international Engineering team in Esbjerg, Denmark and Stavanger, Norway. Possible work locations also include Hamburg, Germany.

The AI/HPC System Engineering team is looking for a Hardware System Design Engineer to design, implement, grow, and maintain the proof of concept development, test, and emulation platforms for Meta's AI/HPC comprised of cutting-edge accelerator, bus and network technologies. This team is working on the design, implementation, and support of one of the world’s largest AI/HPC deployments. In this role, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the future AI/HPC of Meta by specifying technical requirements and steering the industry and ecosystem.This role will be working across many projects in our AI/HPC System team to shape our system design and development requirements across Hardware projects. A successful candidate will be a HW system and platform builder, equally comfortable working on boards, sensors, FPGA RTL design/verification, performance and power test and evaluation, OS/RTOS kernel and driver software and architectures. The position requires a developer, able to debug and extract solutions from vague descriptions of system architecture and workloads, who also builds cross functional relationships across teams to find ideas, assets and assistance to explore faster.

Description:
Canonical is seeking an experienced Python developer to build the world's best open-source portfolio of integrated, secure and reliable software for the telecommunications industry. You will be involved in all the aspects of the software development process: you will design software, write high-quality code and tests, provide insightful code reviews, write documentation and help to troubleshoot issues.

Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and building technology for democratization of Data Centers. Help us build the #1 bare metal cloud system, and work with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical!
The Ubuntu MAAS team is responsible for delivering our Metal As A Service hyperscale provisioning technology. Ubuntu strives to be the most scalable, cloud ready server distribution and MAAS is our platform to get it there. MAAS is a rapidly evolving software stack written in Python and Go, and we are looking for experienced software engineers who understand performance at scale, networking, storage and usability.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of Ubuntu and be able to show technical leadership with a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. This position requires international travel several times a year.

Job_title: Utviklere med datavarehuserfaring — Oslo og Trondheim
Description:
Mer data er lik bedre beslutningsgrunnlag. Likevel er det ikke fullt så enkelt. Data er verdiløse uten kontekst. På samme måte som adferd uten motivasjon og journalister uten medier.
Derfor trenger vi en som deg, som kan sette data i system, i kontekst, og forankre konklusjonene med forretningssiden av selskapet. Først da blir de noe som leder til bedre avgjørelser over tid.
Det blir derfor ditt ansvar å identifisere hva som er gode og dårlige datasett, og vite hva du skal gjøre i begge situasjonene. Hvis du ønsker å hjelpe kundene vi jobber med å forstå og forvalte egne data bedre, da er dette en fin mulighet for oss begge. Ikke bare vil du styrke det tverrfaglige teamet bestående av forretningsutviklere, designere og utviklere, men også forsterke fagmiljøet i Bekk.

Company_name: Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace - Integrated Defence Systems
Description:
Integrated Defence Systems (IDS) er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace. Vi utvikler og leverer avanserte og teknologisk ledende kommando-, kontroll-, og kommunikasjonsløsninger til forsvarskunder nasjonalt og internasjonalt. Hovedprodukter er NASAMS luftvernsystem og forsvarssystem til ubåt og overflatefartøy.
Integrated Defence Systems (IDS) divisjonen er i sterk vekst og vi leter etter både nyutdannede og erfarne ingeniører! Vår spesialitet er systemintegrasjon, datadrevne operasjoner og beslutningsstøtte. Vi samarbeider med anerkjente bedrifter for å utvikle morgendagens forsvarssystemer. Noe av det vi jobber med er den nye norske ubåten, luftvernsystemet NASAMS, nye stridsvogner til Norge. Vi leter etter deg som brenner for teknologi og vil være med på utvikle noen av de mest komplekse systemløsningene i verden. Vi håper du tar utfordringen ved å søke jobb hos oss!

We are asking you to come and join our Nordic team and work as part of Mastercard Payment Services. You will be part of an exciting journey and a dedicated team, working to make payments simpler and safer for everyone.

With the recent acquisition in the Nordics we have entered into an agreement to make our account-to-account payment services part of Mastercard. This is Mastercard’s largest ever acquisition and a step in their strategy to become the industry leader in payment- and banking services.

We are responsible for critical payment systems that you use, probably almost without thinking about it. We work every day to ensure that payments are stable, secure and seamless, both between banks, companies and private individuals. Together with you, we will build and operate market-leading solutions in a competent and pleasant environment.

We are looking for talents with ambitions and passion for what they are doing!

Your professional qualifications include:

Your personal qualifications include:

We can offer you:
COVID-19 Considerations
We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.
In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.
Corporate Security Responsibility

Description:
SpareBank 1 Gruppen AS
Dataingeniør
Bank
SpareBank 1 Nord-Norge er på jakt etter en dyktig og serviceinnstilt data engineer. Har du erfaring som utvikler eller data engineer, eller er nyutdannet og et ønske om å jobbe som dette, så er vi interessert i å snakke med deg.

Hos oss blir du med i et team bestående av 10 medarbeidere som sammen utvikler og forvalter løsninger som bidrar å til å løse SpareBank 1 Nord-Norges utfordringer i sine virksomhetsområder. Du vil jobbe tett med andre miljøer i banken og ha mulighet til å bidra inn i SpareBank 1-alliansen.
Vi snakker gjerne med deg som har utdannelse innenfor informatikk/IT eller andre relevante fagområder. Erfaring som data engineer er ønskelig, men annen kompetanse er også interessant. Du bør ha erfaring med databaser, datamodellering og generell utviklerkompetanse. Dersom du har erfaring med SQL, SAS eller Python er det et pluss. Du har erfaring med å utvikle og vedlikeholde komplekse ETL-er og datagrunnlag. Du evner å samarbeide med analytikere og andre interne kunder for å designe og spesifisere krav. Det er en fordel om du også har erfaring eller kunnskap innenfor økonomi eller finans.
SNN har sannsynligvis Nord-Norges mest spennende jobber innen data og analyse. Vi tilbyr en stilling der du vokser og lærer i et godt og inkluderende arbeidsmiljø. En data engineer i SNN er en nøkkelstilling i et konsern i sterk utvikling, som har en klar nr 1 posisjon i en landsdel med stort utvikling- og verdiskapingspotensial.

Utover lønn tilbyr Sparebank 1 Nord-Norge fleksibel arbeidstid og tilbyr gode betingelser på forsikring, pensjon og lån. Vi har et aktivt bedriftsidrettslag hvor du kan delta på ulike aktiviteter og rabattavtaler på utvalgte treningsstudio.

Description: Meta is hiring ASIC Design Verification Engineer within the Infrastructure organization. We are looking for individuals with experience in Design Verification to build IP and System On Chip (SoC) for data center applications.As a Design Verification Engineer, you will be part of a dynamic team working with the best in the industry, focused on developing innovative ASIC solutions for Facebook’s data center applications. You will be responsible for the verification closure of a design module or sub-system from test-planning, UVM based test bench development to verification closure. Along with traditional simulation, you will be able to use other approaches like Formal and Emulation to achieve a bug-free design. The role also provides ample opportunities to partner and collaborate with full stack software, hardware, ASIC Design, Emulation and Post-Silicon teams towards creating a first-pass silicon success.

Description:
What you will do
Do you want to use your skills and experience in frontend development to contribute to the global renewable energy transition? Our cloud platform is used by the largest renewable energy companies and manufacturers in the world to develop, construct and operate wind farms across the globe.

You will work in an agile environment where you will be involved in different aspects of our development: analysis, design, implementation, automated testing, code reviews and feature testing.

You will be a part of our international Engineering team in Esbjerg, Denmark and Stavanger, Norway. Possible work locations also include Hamburg, Germany.

Description:
Local Unit & Position Description:
DNV is a world-leading provider of digital solutions and software applications for the assurance industry with focus on the energy, maritime and healthcare markets.
Our solutions are used worldwide to manage risk and performance for wind turbines, electric grids, pipelines, processing plants, offshore structures, ships, and more. Supported by our domain knowledge and Veracity industry data platform, we enable companies to digitize and manage business critical activities in a sustainable, cost-efficient, safe, and secure way.

Veracity is DNV’s independent cloud, set out to deliver trust and scale to industry digitalization and decarbonization. It brings together all the key players in the maritime and energy industries, to drive business innovation and digital transformation over a common data truth. On Veracity Marketplace, users can further browse, purchase and access relevant industry data, applications, and digital services. Today, more than 40 000 companies and 300 000 users engage over Veracity, enjoying frictionless connection through the exchange of datasets, APIs, applications, and insights. Visit www.veracity.com to discover more.

Description:
Join the SURF asset integrity team as an engineer and help our clients make better decisions. With cutting-edge methods and tools, you will monitor SURF assets, analyse data, and develop interactive dashboards on our digital platform.
Our team is working closely with clients, helping them get value from understanding data and providing them with the insight they need to keep operating their assets safely and efficiently.
You will be part of a team of highly experienced engineers who are welcoming and passionate about sharing good ideas and knowledge. Together with you, we will continue to build and create new services that are valuable to our clients and partners.
You typically have a strong background in SURF or have experience with integrity management. You also have a keen interest in being involved with creating new services and products for our clients.

Local Unit & Position Description:

Unit Environmental Loading and Response in department Structures is looking for engineers within advanced hydrodynamics, mooring, motion response, metocean criteria, wave statistics and structural reliability to meet an increasing demand for our services in the market and strategic growth ambitions.

Department Structures in service area Offshore Infrastructure & Technology in business area Energy Systems in DNV is a leading competence center within assessments of loadbearing structures, serving the offshore industry across ocean-based sectors. A total work force of 150 subject matter experts (100 in Norway and 50 in Germany) are working in unique teams of world leading experts with different aspects of structural integrity related matters for loadbearing structures such as fixed and floating wind turbines, solar plants, oil and gas structures, fish farms and floating bridges.

Description:
Would you like to be a part of a company that has equipment in space? Do you want to work with tech that works in “harsh conditions”? Do you thrive in an environment in which you get exposure to the whole line of tech, from idea to final product?
At Eidsvoll Electronics AS-EIDEL you will get the chance to take part and work with tech that is used in areas like space, aerospace, defense, security and other places where conditions are harsh on the equipment.
Welcome to EIDEL – Innovative electronics for critical applications in harsh conditions.
The founder of EIDEL was Erik Olson in 1966. He always seemed to seek out new opportunities and had an innovating spirit. This is something that EIDEL have in their core. Today EIDEL have 26 employees and are growing rapidly. But they aim towards keeping their growth controlled and will grow at their own controlled phase.

Business Function Overview:
In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a CO+I CE Field Services Engineer (FSE).
Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I FSE, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development for all employees and offers trainings and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.
Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.

Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Data Centre automation. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
The Ubuntu MAAS team is responsible for delivering our Metal As A Service hyperscale provisioning technology. Ubuntu strives to be the most scalable, cloud ready server distribution and MAAS is our platform to get it there. MAAS is a rapidly evolving software stack written in Python and Go, and we are looking for experienced software engineers who understand performance at scale, networking, storage and usability.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of Ubuntu and be able to show technical leadership with a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. This position requires international travel several times a year.

Do you want to support Dustin’s journey into Azure Cloud? Do you want an opportunity to manage our infrastructure and platform workloads in an Infrastructure as Code setup?
As our CloudOps Engineer, you will be an important part of our expansion in new markets. We are increasing investments in IT to make sure Dustin is ready for the future and are therefore changing our IT platform (Cloud strategy) and way of working to be more agile and have even closer collaboration with our business. This means you will have the opportunity to make a valuable contribution to the organisation and see the project through to its completion.
About the position
The role is internal facing only, and in a 24x7 environment, working closely with the ICT Infrastructure team, supporting our Business and Technology department, and working together with our external partners. In this role, you will be responsible for managing our Infrastructure and Platform workloads in Azure. You will also:

Description:
Mavenir is building the future of networks and pioneering advanced technology, focusing on the vision of a single, software-based automated network that runs on any cloud. As the industry's only end-to-end, cloud-native network software provider, Mavenir is transforming the way the world connects, accelerating software network transformation for 250+ Communications Service Providers in over 120 countries, which serve more than 50% of the world’s subscribers.
Role Summary
The Sr. Technical Operations Engineer will work within the EMEA Operations Team.The purpose of this role is to provide focused technical expertise to EMEA Customers and Operations teams across Mavenir product portfolio and deployments. It will provide the technical interface to other teams both external and within the organisation. It will also ensure an effective flow of information between the teams within operations and facilitate knowledge transfer.
The engineer will need to be technically EPC/5GC/NFV/Kubernetes experienced, be able to assimilate new concepts quickly and be prepared to work in situations where they are learning as they work. They must be good at dealing with peers, other teams within the Mavenir organisation and the customer’s technical staff (including good customer facing hard and soft skills).
This is a hands-on technical role including deployment, integration, trouble shooting and issue resolution. In-depth understanding of the Telecom Protocols and technologies like HTTP2, NGAP, DIAMETER, GTP, S1AP are required.
The engineer will need to be able to work under pressure to complete work to tight time constraints or meet the needs of the customer. Also needs to be able to understand the business context of the project being delivered.

Description:
Cognite is a global leader in industrial software with our Industrial DataOps platform, Cognite Data Fusion®, at the core. We were awarded the 2022 Technology Innovation Leader for Global Digital Industrial Platforms.

The Product team is the team responsible for developing Cognite Data Fusion as a robust and scalable platform for solving industrial data problems at Cognite. The industrial data problem is at the heart of transforming asset-intensive industries to be safer, more sustainable and more profitable. Cognite’s Cognite Data Fusion makes the operational data available at scale and adds value to the data through data processing. This enables asset-intensive industries to make data-driven decisions. Our platform is built on many different technologies, each good at solving various challenges.

To build the best possible product, we believe in autonomous teams with developers, designers and product managers working closely together. You will be working on improving the value of data in Cognite through data processing. That means that our users have the best data quality possible, as well as ensure better insights for the user through the use of data science and physical process modelling. We use the latest technologies and work closely with end users to iterate quickly towards better product experiences.

Job_title: Data Engineer til et viktig oppdrag hos en tung statlig...
Description:
TechnoGarden IT er et konsulentselskap som opererer innenfor et bredt spekter av IT-roller, fra utvikling og testing, til drift og infrastruktur, i tillegg til prosjektledelse og rådgivning. Både offentlig og privat sektor er blant våre kunder, som gjenspeiles gjennom en bredde av oppdragsgivere som spenner fra eksempelvis bank og finans til offentlige etater.

Vi ser etter en Data Engineer for en tung aktør innen offentlig økonomisk forvaltning hvor du vil få et stort samfunnsmessig ansvar. Du vil jobbe med utvikling og forvaltning av datavarehusløsninger.

Du har:

Høyere formell kompetanse i informasjonsteknologiske fag

Vi ønsker snarlig oppstart, og det kreves at du jobber onsite i Oslo 3 dager i uken. Oppdraget har en forventet varighet ut 2022, og kun kandidater med flytende norsk vil bli vurdert.

Det holdes intervjuer og samtaler med aktuelle kandidater fortløpende. Målet er å føre en rask og effektiv prosess med deg som kandidat i sentrum. Er du interessert eller har spørsmål du sitter inne med så ikke nøl med å ta kontakt på mail randulf.arnoy@technogarden.no eller over telefon 90936064.

Description:
Help us shape the future of open source IT, devops, and IS, from bare metal to containers. Our goal is to revolutionise open source application and infrastructure operations.
We are on a mission to reshape the world of software operations, using Python for next-generation infrastructure-as-code and blazing a trail to model-driven operations. We want to enable companies to run very efficient bare metal operations for high performance computing, private cloud, data lakes and analytics. To achieve this we need to invent some new technology, and we need to build some new products. In support of that goal we hire software engineers who are passionate about quality, reliability and devops, to join our regional devops teams.
This team is part of our fully managed infrastructure operations organisation. We run many private clouds and Kubernetes clusters for customers around the world, which enables us to improve our infra-as-code products based on our own real experience, mirroring that of our users and customers. We work in Python, creating open source operations capabilities that simplify these operations for anybody, worldwide, who is building on Ubuntu.

Description:
Hansen Technologies is a leading global provider of customer care and billing software as well as data management systems. With deep expertise, the flexibility and power of HansenCX products deliver a leading customer experience in four major industry sectors: Energy and Utilities, Water, Pay-TV and Telecommunications. Founded in 1971, Hansen now employs over 1000 people and has 31 offices around the globe. One of our key Customer Information Systems (CIS) for energy and utility markets in Nordic is called EnoroCX. It is today used by more than 120 energy companies in Nordic countries, mostly in Finland and Norway.

We are looking for a Test Engineer to our EnoroCX team to work with our Nordic customers. This position would be based in our office s in Norway (Oslo, Dale, Førde or Lillehammer) , but we organize remote working for suitable candidates.

Description:
IC Digital Design Engineer
For Sony Semiconductor Solutions - Europe Design Center
Location: Lysaker, Norway
We are seeking a Digital Design Engineer that will be involved in the design and development of advanced CMOS image sensors. The Digital Design Engineer will be part of an international team that works in the design of timing and control signals for pixel array readout, amplifiers, and analogue/digital converters, signal processing blocks for noise reduction and colour enhancement, as well as I/O interfaces and low noise power supplies for use in Sony Semiconductor Solutions Image Sensors and similar specialty state-of-the-art products.
You will be part of a multi-discipline camera and imaging systems team, defining and documenting specifications, as well as developing RTL/firmware to control the sensor and process the video data. You will be a hands-on contributor who will also take full responsibility for the success of the design.

Job_title: Linux System Engineer - QA, Tooling, Automation
Description:
We are seeking a software engineer passionate about software quality, Ubuntu, and the open source community, to join the Ubuntu Quality Engineering team as we expand the set of open source packages we fully support and secure.
We see quality engineering as a first class engineering practice and are looking for people who can bring deep engineering insights to automation, testing capabilities, reporting and data analytics, as well as run processes in partnership with Canonical and community teams.
Ubuntu strives to deliver the latest-best free software components, in an easy to use and highly reliable form. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer the industry.
As an Ubuntu Quality Engineer, you must be passionate about the future of Ubuntu, about quality and continuous integration and testing. You will work closely with multiple teams at the heart of Ubuntu and drive quality excellence. You will work closely with the Ubuntu Desktop, Server and Foundations team and put in place metrics for quality. You will research existing issues, troubleshoot and resolve problems, and identify opportunities for improvement and communicate them to the rest of the organization to drive the overall quality of Ubuntu.

Description:
Canonical seeks an experienced developer with a proven track record in Python and/or Go. As part of the Observability team, you will develop a cloud-native monitoring stack that composes best-in-class open-source monitoring tools. The stack is opinionated, resilient, and scalable, providing deep insights out of the box. The user experience is polished and seamless for the end-users, and its administrators will enjoy smooth, lightweight Day 1 and Day 2 operations.
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Kubernetes, and Observability. Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu.
The monitoring stack will monitor applications running on a mix of cloud technologies such as Kubernetes and OpenStack, as well as bare-metal, virtual machines and containers. The stack will be capable of monitoring applications and infrastructure irrespective of whether they are operated by Juju, and will leverage multiple data sources at various levels of the architecture, including Juju itself, to contextualize the collected telemetry and insights delivered to the end-users.

Description:

Job_title: Norconsult satser ytterligere på digitalisering; Nå vil vi satse på deg som er interessert i maskinlæring og data science!
Description:
Vi søker deg med en lidenskap for maskinlæring og kunstig intelligens. Du verdsetter et sterkt faglig miljø hvor trivsel og egenutvikling står i sentrum. Om du ønsker å kalle deg Dataanalytiker, Data Scientist, Data Engineer eller ML Engineer er ikke så viktig for oss. Det som er viktig er at du har en forståelse for data, maskinlæring, kunstig intelligens og programmering, og ikke minst et brennende ønske om å utvikle deg faglig innen disse områdene.
Norconsult Informasjonssystemer (NoIS) er et av Norges største programvarehus og leverer digitale løsninger og tjenester for planlegging, prosjektering, bygging og forvaltning av infrastruktur og eiendom. Vi har ledende fagmiljø innen Geografiske Informasjonssystemer (GIS), kommunaltekniske løsninger, Forvaltning, Drift og Vedlikehold (FDV), prosjektadministrasjon, prosjektstyring, kostnadsanalyser, byggeteknisk konstruksjon og Bygningsinformasjonsmodeller (BIM).

24M Technologies answers the world’s need for affordable energy storage by enabling a new, more cost-effective solution — SemiSolidTM lithium-ion technology. Through strategic partnerships with industry leaders, including the Volkswagen Group, Kyocera, GPSC and FREYR, 24M has built an ecosystem to rapidly scale the SemiSolidTM platform and develop a better, cleaner energy future. Founded in 2010 and led by some of the battery industry’s foremost inventors, scientists and entrepreneurs, 24M is headquartered in Cambridge, Mass. and backed by top industrial partners and venture capital firms. Description:
Mechanical Construction Manager – Data Center – NORWAY- Rotation

OUR CLIENT:

Our client is a very well established large main contractor with numerous diverse projects. They are heavily involved in the construction of data centers and require a Mechanical supervisor to add to their project team on a new build datacentre in Oslo.

No previous experience on Data Centers is required for the right candidate with the right attitude. The position is immediate.

THE ROLE:

Mechanical construction Manager - Datacentre - NORWAY



Supervisiopn of Mechanical supervisors and subcontractors

Management of Site Safety in conjunction with the Safety Advisor. This will include the setup, management of and closing out of the safety file as part of the Management team.

Management of Site QA in conjunction with the Mechanical Package manager including set up, management and close out of file.

Familiarity with and management of Project Schedule in conjunction with other trades, Package Leads, consulting Engineer and Client requirements

Assist with the management of all costs associated with your package including:

o Mechanical Team

o Sub-contractors

o Material deliveries and goods receipting.

o Plant and Equipment

o Variations

o Valuations

Management of all day to day on site operations



10yrs plus experience.

Ventilation and Pipework experience

Strong management skills

Either trade or professional qualification



Please forward your CV through this website or contact Kevin on 0035314586006/00353872790484 or email kevin@kcmrecruitment.ie. Your recruiter has 20 years experience in construction recruitment.

You will receive an excellent remuneration package in line with your experience. Flights every 3 week , excellent accommodation for your downtime, a living allowance to cover food, transport etc.



Established in 2004, KCM is owned and managed by construction professionals who recruit solely in the construction sector both in Ireland and internationally. We offer 100% confidentiality to candidates and specialise in finding roles within the construction industry for candidates who are returning from oversees or professionals who are looking at new opportunities in the domestic market.

Brenner du for kunstig intelligens og maskinlæring? Og vil du jobbe med hvordan slike løsninger kan bygge framtidens IT-løsninger sammen med tradisjonelle systemer? Da bør du søke denne jobben.
Du blir en viktig brikke i et agilt team som jobber med å realisere potensialet til ML og AI. Rollen er først og fremst relatert til MLOps og du jobber i grensesnittet mellom Data Science og IT. En sentral del er å bygge systemer som gjør at vi kan produksjonssette og overvåke maskinlæringsmodeller kontinuerlig. Vi er spesielt interessert i deg som er interessert i moderne IT-infrastruktur, samt utvikling og forvaltning av APIer i en mikrotjenestearkitektur.

Om jobben
I denne jobben jobber du med å utvikle verktøy for overvåkning av ML-modeller slik at vi kan sikre at de fungerer som forventet og gir gode resultater. Vi bruker Dataiku som maskinlæringsplatform. Konfigurasjon og overvåking av plattformen er en viktig del av arbeidsoppgavene i denne jobben.

Description:
Tampnet is now looking for a Core Network Engineer join the team
Our business is growing, and we are looking for a Core Network Engineer (NE) to join our Mobile Team in Stavanger, Norway. The NE is a member of the Core, Cloud and Software team responsible for management of the LTE/5G core network infrastructure and involved in the long-term strategy for the development of Tampnet's core network services. The management of the LTE /5G core network infrastructure applies to architecture, operations, maintenance, NOC services and improvements projects. The NE reports to the Manager, Core, Cloud and Software.

By joining Tampnet, you will be a part of an exciting Company with an entrepreneurial mindset. You will be part of a group with talented individuals who work together across geographies on common objectives that all culminate in one goal: always to take Tampnet to new levels. We are proud to be the worldwide leading offshore communications provider contributing to making the planet greener while improving people's lives.

Job_title: Er du en rev på Azure?
Description:
Vil du jobbe i et spennende team med startup-kultur som har støtte fra et av de største konsulentselskapene i verden?
I Capgemini Insights & Data i Stavanger bygger vi et startup-team som skal være en vekstmaskin og et center of excellence for dataplattform, dataanalyse, data science, data governance, knowledge graphs og IoT for energi og industri-sektoren. Vi tenker og jobber som en startup, og har i 2022 bevist at det fungerer. Vi er et multikulturelt, tverrfaglig og høykompetent team. Vi har både spesialister på dataplattform fra IT-siden og fra energi og industri. Det betyr at vi har spesialister på for eksempel operasjon og velikehold, subsurface, drilling, nye energiformer, bærekraft og finans, som nå arbeider med dataanalyse, data science og rådgivning rundt dataplattformer hos våre kunder.
Vi er kompromissløst inkluderende, har som målsetning at vi skal være det beste stedet i bransjen å jobbe, og alle som jobber hos oss jobber kontinuerlig med å lære seg nye ting. Ettersom vi primært arbeider med teknologi i Microsoft Azure, er det viktig at nye medlemmer av vårt team har erfaring fra arbeid i Azure og/eller relevante sertifiseringer på denne plattformen. Det er også interessant om du har erfaring eller utdannelse fra disipliner i olje og gass, nye energiformer eller industri og produksjon.

CBRE Data Centre Solutions (DCS) is a part of the CBRE Group with over 115.000 employees worldwide and delivers fully integrated real estate, facilities and technology solutions for data centre owners, occupiers and investors across the globe. As a dedicated business line within CBRE, DCS is dedicated to solving complex challenges within every stage of the data centre lifecycle.

As a subcontracted advisor through Belcan, you will deploy to our customers and/or suppliers as needed to support projects related to Aerospace and Space manufacturing, quality, and supply chain.

Job_title: Vil du jobbe som IT utvikler hos oss?
Description:
Vi gir drømmen en sjanse! - det er vår visjon. Hver dag oppfyller Norsk Tipping både store og små drømmer rundt om i det ganske land, både for spillerne og overskuddsmottakerne. Vil du være med å skape nye drømmer? Er det å inngå i et engasjert og dyktig fagmiljø hvor det blir lagt stor vekt på kompetanseutvikling og kompetansedeling noe du trives med? Da kan denne muligheten være noe for deg! Vi søker folk til flere stillinger innenfor IT-utvikling.
En varierende hverdag med gode utviklingsmuligheter
Vi har mange tverrfaglige utviklingsteam og vi ser etter deg som har et sterkt ønske om å virke og utvikle deg innen faget. For å få rask feedback fra kundene jobber vi smidig og har en høy leveransetakt hvor samarbeidet på tvers i organisasjonen og en automatisert leveranseprosess har blitt helt essensielt. Du vil bli en del av et engasjert team og vil bidra i utvikling av moderne og spennende kundeopplevelser.

Company_name: Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace - Integrated Defence Systems
Description:
Integrated Defence Systems (IDS) er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace. Vi utvikler og leverer avanserte og teknologisk ledende kommando-, kontroll-, og kommunikasjonsløsninger til forsvarskunder nasjonalt og internasjonalt. Hovedprodukter er NASAMS luftvernsystem og forsvarssystem til ubåt og overflatefartøy.

Er du ingeniøren som vil være med å sikre systemers levetid?
Integrated Defence Systems (IDS) divisjonen er i sterk vekst og vi leter etter både nyutdannede og erfarne ingeniører! Vår spesialitet er systemintegrasjon, datadrevne operasjoner og beslutningsstøtte. Vi samarbeider med anerkjente bedrifter for å utvikle morgendagens forsvarssystemer. Noe av det vi jobber med er den nye norske ubåten, luftvernsystemet NASAMS og nye stridsvogner til Norge. Vi leter etter deg som brenner for teknologi og vil være med på utvikle noen av de mest komplekse systemløsningene i verden. Vi håper du tar utfordringen ved å søke jobb hos oss!
Du vil bli del av Systems Engineering avdelingen som består av 70 engasjerte personer. Du vil jobbe tett med et team bestående av dyktige ingeniører som jobber sammen for å lage brilliante og trygge systemer for våre kunder. Vi leverer systemer i Norge og over store deler av verden, så har du lyst å reise litt er det muligheter for dette. Du er nysgjerrig, engasjert og ryddig slik at resultatet blir gode levetids- og oppgraderingsvurderinger for våre kunder.

Kongsberg Maritime is a global maritime technology company, providing innovative and reliable technology solutions for all maritime industry sectors. Kongsberg Maritime has a leading position in systems for positioning, surveying, navigation, and automation. In addition, we see several new market areas for our technology and products, for instance energy and aquaculture. Our technology plays an essential role in optimizing maritime operations for a sustainable, future oriented business. We work in close cooperation with our customers, suppliers, and research institutions.
By joining Kongsberg Maritime, you will have the opportunity to be a part of our ambitious goals and make a difference to the direction of this industry. Our world leading products and solutions are running on highly reliable real-time platforms, while we continue to look out for and develop next generation technologies necessary to fulfill our ambitions for the future.

Description:
Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?
At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future. We are changemakers and problem solvers with more than 180 years of experience. Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?
We are specialists in managing large projects from feasibility studies and conceptual engineering, through FEED and detailed engineering.
Engineering is executing major projects across the globe in both oil and gas and renewables sectors. This includes Norway’s ground-breaking Brevik carbon capture project, as well as delivering engineering and design for Northern Lights, the world’s first CO₂ storage facility on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. Furthermore, we are investigating the design and delivery of future hydrogen and ammonia projects.

Description:
At Cognite we want to make data do more. We create software that turns industrial data into customer value. The products we develop are only possible when leading software engineers and industrial operations experts build together.

Our Database Reliability Engineering team (DBRE) writes the systems that operate the databases we use. In this role, you would develop the open-source Golang operator and associated internal deployment, monitoring, and general operations capabilities for FoundationDB.

FoundationDB is a cornerstone of our high capacity time series API - an important part of Cognite’s products. The times series team works closely with DBRE, allowing you to feel the impact of your work.

This role is available both remotely - from anywhere on earth - and in Oslo, Norway as a regular on-site role.

CBRE Data Centre Solutions (DCS) is a part of the CBRE Group with over 115.000 employees worldwide and delivers fully integrated real estate, facilities and technology solutions for data centre owners, occupiers and investors across the globe. As a dedicated business line within CBRE, DCS is dedicated to solving complex challenges within every stage of the data centre lifecycle.
Green Mountain has exclusively partnered with CBRE to staff our new data center site in Hamar. We need numerous positions within Operations to support what will become Norway’s largest data center. Description:
The company is a leading supplier of projects within electrification, offshore wind and life extension, and has a clear objective to make a strong contribution towards the green shift. Planned end date: 31.12.23 (1år)

automation design and responsibilities from green field projects to be located on Norwegian Continental Shelf.
Minimum 2 years’ Experience from automation system design activities and responsibility from green field
Offshore Feed or study phase projects.
Experience and deep knowledge of automation design according to relevant standards such as
NORSOK, ATEX, PTIL, ISO and IEC
Detail knowledge of Equinor technical requirements (TRs)

Description:
Are you passionate about the energy transition? Join us.
Nel is a global, dedicated hydrogen company, delivering optimal solutions to produce, store, and distribute hydrogen from renewable energy. We serve a range of different customers with leading hydrogen technologies. Our roots date back to 1927, and since then, we have had a proud history of development and continuous improvement of hydrogen technologies. Today, our solutions cover the entire value chain: from hydrogen production technologies to hydrogen fueling stations, enabling industries to transition to green hydrogen, and providing fuel cell electric vehicles with the same fast fueling and long range as fossil-fueled vehicles – without the emissions.

Nel's technology department develops the next generation of technologies and products to support Nel's future business plans. The department has a global footprint with personnel and laboratory infrastructure in Norway, Denmark and the US. Important development areas include alkaline and PEM electrolysers and hydrogen fueling stations, both current and new technologies. Green hydrogen has been identified as one of the most important factors in supporting the reduction of CO2 emissions from traditional industry and transport. Development of new technologies and products adapted to operation with renewable energy such as wind and solar is seen as crucial to support the growth of the green hydrogen industry.

The technology department is now hiring. We are looking for highly motivated employees to grow the team. You will play an important role in the development activities and be a part of the team realizing the Nel R&D goals. The position reports to Technology Director at Nel Hydrogen Electrolyser.

Job_title: Bli med å bygge vår videre satsing innen Business Analytics
Description:
Har du erfaring med implementering av løsninger innen Business Intelligence eller Analytics, og er sulten på nye utfordringer og ønsker å være med å bygge regionens beste BA-miljø?
Da håper vi du vil du være med på laget vårt. Som et av regionens ledende digitale rådgivningsmiljø vil du få en unik karrieremulighet. Vi er i sterk vekst og ser etter nye kolleger til vårt satsningsområde Business Analytics. Avhengig av din kompetanse kan du gå inn i rollen som Data Analyst, Data Engineer, løsningsarkitekt, prosjektleder og/eller forretningsrådgiver innen data og analyse. Du vil få mulighet til å hjelpe spennende kunder med teknologivalg, veiledning og strategisk rådgivning, og til å finne smarte løsninger på komplekse problemstillinger med utgangspunkt i ulik teknologi og plattformer; eksempelvis Python, SQL, DAX, Azure Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, Databricks, dbt, Power BI og andre innsiktsverktøy.

Machine Learning Engineer - Oslo
2801223_DS_LRW_1674836408
We are looking for a machine learning engineer in Oslo!

Joining a growing internal team based in central Oslo, working alongside some talented data scientists, machine learning engineers and developers, you will work with the latest technologies, and work completely end to end on ML projects.

You will research, develop and evaluate ML models, and explore large/unstructured data sets from a range of sources

With a large stream of real-time data, you will work predominantly with time series analysis to forecast supply, demand and cost

You will work with data from various sources, and be tasked with identifying trends and anomalies, and coming up with solutions to provide the analysis and insights customers need to solve their problems, become more efficient, and help create a more sustainable energy industry

As a company with data-driven insights at the very centre of it's offerings, you can be sure you'll be working as part of a dedicated team with all of the resources and tools you need to be productive

With an innovative working culture, and plenty of encouragement to experiment, it is a safe place to grow your skillset and develop professionally whilst working on some of the most cutting edge ML projects in the energy industry

This role is an opportunity for a senior software architect to build a career with Canonical and drive the architecture of internally developed and deployed software solutions.
The Commercial Systems team closely collaborates with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. Services designed, developed, and operated by the Commercial Systems team are used by millions of machines all over the world. Designing and developing these systems requires a high degree of understanding of distributed systems and appreciation for business critical systems and the value of data flowing between the systems. It is crucial for services developed by the Commercial Systems team to flawlessly and securely operate 24/7 and to allow for seamless integration with solutions developed and used by other teams at Canonical, while keeping security at the forefront. Apply here if you would like to be at the center of connecting all the dots and drive the architecture of such software solutions.

Description:

We are looking for a senior instrument engineer to work in a large, unmanned EPC greenfield oil&gas offshore project. Design, coordination and follow up of Metering packages and systems

Analyse og dataplattform, SpareBank 1 Nord-Norge
Sted:
9008 Tromsø
Stillingstittel:
Dataingeniør
Søknadsfrist:
12.04.2023
SpareBank 1 Nord-Norge er på jakt etter en dyktig og serviceinnstilt data engineer. Har du erfaring som utvikler eller data engineer, eller er nyutdannet og et ønske om å jobbe som dette, så er vi interessert i å snakke med deg.

Hos oss blir du med i et team bestående av 10 medarbeidere som sammen utvikler og forvalter løsninger som bidrar å til å løse SpareBank 1 Nord-Norges utfordringer i sine virksomhetsområder. Du vil jobbe tett med andre miljøer i banken og ha mulighet til å bidra inn i SpareBank 1-alliansen.
Hos oss vil du ha ansvar for å innhente data fra eksterne og interne kilder, bearbeide og omforme disse til dataprodukter og vedlikeholde de i dataplattformen. Du tar en aktiv en rolle i utvikling av dataplattformen og bidrar med ny kunnskap inn i egen og andre avdelinger i SpareBank 1 Nord-Norge.
Vi snakker gjerne med deg som har utdannelse innenfor informatikk/IT eller andre relevante fagområder. Erfaring som data engineer er ønskelig, men annen kompetanse er også interessant. Du bør ha erfaring med databaser, datamodellering og generell utviklerkompetanse. Dersom du har erfaring med SQL, SAS eller Python er det et pluss. Du har erfaring med å utvikle og vedlikeholde komplekse ETL-er og datagrunnlag. Du evner å samarbeide med analytikere og andre interne kunder for å designe og spesifisere krav. Det er en fordel om du også har erfaring eller kunnskap innenfor økonomi eller finans. Vi snakker gjerne med deg som har utdannelse innenfor informatikk/IT eller andre relevante fagområder. Erfaring som data engineer er ønskelig, men annen kompetanse er også interessant. Du bør ha erfaring med databaser, datamodellering og generell utviklerkompetanse. Dersom du har erfaring med SQL, SAS eller Python er det et pluss. Du har erfaring med å utvikle og vedlikeholde komplekse ETL-er og datagrunnlag. Du evner å samarbeide med analytikere og andre interne kunder for å designe og spesifisere krav. Det er en fordel om du også har erfaring eller kunnskap innenfor økonomi eller finans. SNN har sannsynligvis Nord-Norges mest spennende jobber innen data og analyse. Vi tilbyr en stilling der du vokser og lærer i et godt og inkluderende arbeidsmiljø. En data engineer i SNN er en nøkkelstilling i et konsern i sterk utvikling, som har en klar nr 1 posisjon i en landsdel med stort utvikling- og verdiskapingspotensial.

Utover lønn tilbyr Sparebank 1 Nord-Norge fleksibel arbeidstid og tilbyr gode betingelser på forsikring, pensjon og lån. Vi har et aktivt bedriftsidrettslag hvor du kan delta på ulike aktiviteter og rabattavtaler på utvalgte treningsstudio.
Matthieu Darner, Leder, 48008170

Software Developer - Bergen
200123_SDB_LRW_1674231840
As companies seek to become more data-driven, we aim to provide meaningful insights through a range of products and solutions tailored for the aquaculture industry

Using tools to present Big Data in a format that is readable and understandable to non-technical stakeholders is an important part of ensuring companies are able to make data-driven decisions, and truly understand their status

We seek to make this simple - and hope you can help us to develop further!

Contributing towards environmental sustainability is a large part of what we work on, and your work with help customers to achieve this simply and effectively

Our product presents real-time and future projections of key factors impacting the aquaculture industry - these include forecasting of growth, temperature, weight, and cost. It allows our customers to interact with the current & future state by updating and inputting changes

As part of the development team, your responsibilities can include the following:


We are looking for you to have the following skills & experiences:


(Please note extensive experience in one or more of the above might cover for the lack of experience in something else!)

Why work with us?

Along with an excellent compensation package including bonus options, you will also receive enhanced pension, health/travel/life insurances

Hybrid working and flexitime is available to suit your needs and lifestyle, and a modern office is open to those who choose to travel in

You will be joining an international team based in Bergen who are passionate about learning, technology, and sustainability - collaboration between development and data teams is encouraged, and you will get to know all areas of the business

We know you care about technology - that's why we work with the latest versions, and are continually experimenting with new tools. Idea-generation is encouraged at all levels, and you can take ownership of your work & not be afraid to innovate or try something new

Working end-to-end on products and solutions which contribute towards the green transition means your creations will help us move towards a more sustainable future - the challenges can be new & complex, but with your expertise and a strong team alongside you, we overcome these together

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@jeffersonfrank.com

The Rental coordinator / Tool Pool Coordinator is responsible for allocating tooling to internal customers and coordinates tools maintenance
Responsible for allocation of Surface tooling to internal customers based on SAP requests according to requirements and within defined timeframe.

Responsible for defining technical scope to workshop and external suppliers with support from Maintenance Engineer and Life of Field Department
Responsible for follow up of assigned scope of work/ job package progress towards the workshop & external suppliers.

At Moreld Ross Offshore we understand the lifecycle of an oil field – and know exactly what you need, every step of the way. We have been in your shoes.

We live to solve difficult challenges and find the best solutions tailored for you. We help you fill the gaps – and we do it fast. Our workforce is flexible and highly adaptable. Equipped with technology that enables us to deliver quality and work efficiently regardless of location.

We are proud to be competent team players. Our workforce is hard working, highly experienced within oil services AND has guaranteed experience from the NCS. We work together, across fields to ensure your success.
Duration: 01.08.2023 - 01.08.2025


Perform drilling engineering technical work in close collaboration with subsurface, exploration, projects, Alliance partners, D&W Asset Managers and drilling superintendent.
The position holder supports clients well planning and reports to the project Asset Drilling Manager. Experience with Multi-Lateral Wells is viewed as an advantage. The position holder will demonstrate strong commitment to the HSSE and quality standards within client and Norwegian rules and regulations.








Work location Stavanger.
Some offshore work can be expected.

Job_title: Vil du være med på å utvikle vedlikeholdsstrategien til Nordens største hurtigladenettverk for elbil?
Description:
Er du en analytisk og teknisk dyktig ingeniør som liker å løse komplekse problemer og implementere innovative løsninger? Da kan du være den perfekte kandidaten for stillingen som Reliability and Maintenance Engineer i Recharge.
Om rollen:
Som Reliability and Maintenance Engineer vil du bistå med å utvikle og implementere strategier for å optimalisere og forbedre påliteligheten og vedlikeholdet av vår ladeinfrastruktur i Norden. Dette innebærer å utføre analyser av data og finne løsninger for å redusere nedetid og forbedre ytelsen på ladenettverket i et livsløpsperspektiv.
Du vil ha ansvar med å forberede, planlegge, bestille og følge opp vedlikeholdsoppgaver, samt delta i rot årsaksanalyser relatert til topphendelser eller for å forbedre, lære og optimalisere. Utvikling av prosesser og rutiner blir også en viktig del av jobben. Du kommer til å ha en direkte innvirkning på selskapets strategier, planer og utvikling.

Azure Data Architect
Permanent Employment – Norway
As an Azure Data Architect, you will be part of the strategic team to work along with multi-disciplinary teams through the full delivery lifecycle of complex data products and pipelines with a clear understanding of large-scale data engineering and data analytics solutions leveraging the Azure platform. You will also be part of larger Cognizant Architect community already providing world class solutions to some of the most complex business problems across the globe
About Cognizant
Cognizant (Nasdaq-100:CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

Description:
This engineering role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success of those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development, you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
The Commercial Systems unit has several areas of responsibility spread across five engineering teams, closely collaborating with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. Services designed, developed, and operated by the Commercial Systems unit are deployed to millions of machines worldwide.
The first area of responsibility is centered around security. We develop and operate Ubuntu Pro and Livepatch backend services that support the authentication, authorization, and delivery of Extended Security Maintenance (ESM) at scale to a wide range of devices spanning from individual systems to large enterprise fleets running in cloud environments.

Description:
Company Description

Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That is what we offer. 125 years of unrivaled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. We envision a world that runs entirely on renewable energy. Because in the fight against climate change, we do not see renewable energy as part of the solution – we believe it must be the solution. With us, you will shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.
But there is more work to be done – that is why we need you to join!
Your department
The ‘O&M Technology & Process’ department provides governance and services to Statkraft assets to enable optimization of operations and maintenance of our assets and has a key role to lead and develop state-of the art technical solutions, safeguard critical functions, with focus on lifetime asset perspective, group synergies and cost effectiveness for Statkraft as a whole. Following Statkraft strategy towards 2030 with strong wind power growth ambitions, a dedicated Wind Power- unit has been established to provide Group O&M functions with the goal to secure competitive operations and maintenance at scale for our wind assets. Group O&M has a group-wide responsibility to define requirements, processes and guidelines on how to conduct O&M in Statkraft and to review the implementation of these. Group O&M delivers standardized services that enable Statkraft to capture value from synergies and provides expertise support to business units in both the development and operational phases.

Description:
Cognite is a global leader in industrial software with our Industrial DataOps platform, Cognite Data Fusion®, at the core. We were awarded the 2022 Technology Innovation Leader for Global Digital Industrial Platforms.

The Product team is the team responsible for developing Cognite Data Fusion as a robust and scalable platform for solving industrial data problems at Cognite. The industrial data problem is at the heart of transforming asset-intensive industries to be safer, more sustainable and more profitable. Cognite’s Cognite Data Fusion makes the operational data available at scale and adds value to the data through data processing. This enables asset-intensive industries to make data-driven decisions. Our platform is built on many different technologies, each good at solving various challenges.

To build the best possible product, we believe in autonomous teams with developers, designers and product managers working closely together. Our teams are working on building the next-generation industrial data platform and applications across many different industries, such as Oil & Gas, Manufacturing, and Power & Utility. This includes enabling all types of workflows, including analytics, to assist in making better decisions. We are a good mix of engineers, products, and design. What we have in common is that we care deeply about the user experience and that we create products that users really want to use.

Job_title: Data Center Technician / Critical Services Technician - Data Center (all genders)
Description:
ABOUT CBRE

CBRE Data Centre Solutions (DCS) is a part of the CBRE Group with over 115.000 employees worldwide and delivers fully integrated real estate, facilities and technology solutions for data centre owners, occupiers and investors across the globe. As a dedicated business line within CBRE, DCS is dedicated to solving complex challenges within every stage of the data centre lifecycle.

Green Mountain has exclusively partnered with CBRE to staff our new data center site in Hamar. We need numerous positions within Operations to support what will become Norway’s largest data center. As a CBRE employee at Green Mountain you will be an integrated and important part of the Green Mountain team. The data center will be your permanent workplace where you also will enroll in our joint training and development program. You will be working alongside colleagues from both companies and share a common vision, values, work culture and objectives.

Join us now in HAMAR (Norway) and bring your unique talent and skills to our Team.

Tasks

YOUR CHALLENGES - IMPRESSIVE

The main purpose of this role is to support the daily MRO (maintenance, repair, overhaul) works on site focussing on mechanical & electronics and to ensure a 24/7 Data Center operations.


Requirements

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS - WANTED

Benefits

OUR BENEFITS - CONVINCING

Do you need more good reasons? Please take a look on our recent won awards:

ARE YOU IN?

Have we aroused your interest? If yes, please submit your application documents (CV, selected certificates, no cover letter necessary) incl. your availability and the ref. no. 110037 and salary expectations via our application system

For the sake of the environment, we kindly ask you to apply exclusively via e-Mail and to refrain from post applications.

Description:
Canonical is a pioneer in the digital workplace, established in 2004 with a global, remote-first policy that has delivered world class open source and sets the pace in cloud, developer and IoT technology.
We want Canonical to remain the best at remote work. It's part of our enjoyment of our mission - both to deliver the world's best free software, and to push the boundaries of 21st-century work and collaboration. It seems that everyone had a taste of remote work in the past few years, but at Canonical we think it can continue to evolve and improve. We want to take our remote-first workplace to the next level, and are investing in the next wave of tooling to support and streamline our operation.
Our goal is to improve the state of the art even further in key business processes for a distributed team: hiring, collaboration, communication, learning, documentation, development, and open source development. We want to understand our distributed teams as well as we could understand co-located teams. We want to help them work better, be happier, and make better decisions.

Job_title: Developer for a Modern Data Platform - Oslo
Description:
Developer for a Modern Data Platform - Oslo
220223_DDP_LRW_1677049209
We are searching for a developer to join an established data & analytics team in Oslo building a modern platform on cloud

Your role will involve designing, developing and delivering solutions to help organisations become more data-driven based on predictive and advanced analytics

Your tasks can include:

Working on projects related to API development and integrations

You will work with modern technologies including Python, SQL, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes

We are looking for you to have some of the following skills & experiences:


As a cross-functional team, we look for you to bring excellent communications skills, a desire to create new solutions and explore new technologies, and the ability to take initiative & ownership over your tasks

You can benefit from personal and professional development opportunities to further your career with options to take courses, certifications, attend industry events, and host your own workshops!

There are good pension and insurance schemes, along with high-spec equipment, flexitime and hybrid working options

Whilst fully remote working is not an option yet, we do have multiple offices around Norway which may be closer to home for you!

Our offices are spacious and modern, with excellent lunch options and on-site facilities to make your days in office as comfortable as possible

We encourage employees to be themselves at work and have fun! We hope you can support us on our journey to becoming the most inclusive working environment

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@jeffersonfrank.com

Description:
BI Developer - Oslo
090323_BI_LRW_1678341609
We are looking for a BI Developer to join an established data team in Oslo!

You will be working on some of the most complex challenges facing the Finance industry in Norway, and be part of helping teams move towards modern data solutions including a platform on Azure and the development of a new data warehouse

As part of an international organisation, with a Tech Hub based in Oslo, you will be involved in reporting services and working with lots of new quality data sources

There are existing solutions to be modernised, along with building and adding new dimensions and KPIs

You will work with internal stakeholders to ensure the delivery of robust solutions, and collaborate closely with the wider data team which consists of engineers, analysts and advisors

We hope that you can contribute ideas, opinions, new information, and together with experienced colleagues facilitate the data to allow corporate strategy targets to be achieved

We are looking for you to have:


Qualities and mind-set are equally important!

We hope that you thrive on working closely with the business, and generating value to our customers. You should have a genuine curiosity for taking on new challenges and exploring opportunities

A strong analytical mindset with ability to convert challenges into robust technical solutions, and an interest in developing new skills and sharing knowledge with others

What we can offer you...

For the right candidate we offer the opportunity to play a key role in further develop the companies' analysis capabilities in a team of highly skilled data enthusiasts

Personal development plans and programs to help you achieve your personal and professional goals

A competitive compensation package including enhanced pension, health insurances, and modern equipment

Flexible working conditions with hybrid office/home options, and flexitime

A senior and professional team to spar with, and a strong knowledge-sharing culture

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@jeffersonfrank.com

Description:
Company Description

Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That is what we offer. 125 years of unrivaled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. We envision a world that runs entirely on renewable energy. Because in the fight against climate change, we do not see renewable energy as part of the solution – we believe it must be the solution. With us, you will shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.
But there is more work to be done – that is why we need you to join!
Your department
The ‘O&M Technology & Process’ department provides governance and services to Statkraft assets to enable optimization of operations and maintenance of our assets and has a key role to lead and develop state-of the art technical solutions, safeguard critical functions, with focus on lifetime asset perspective, group synergies and cost effectiveness for Statkraft as a whole. Following Statkraft strategy towards 2030 with strong wind power growth ambitions, a dedicated Wind Power- unit has been established to provide Group O&M functions with the goal to secure competitive operations and maintenance at scale for our wind assets. Group O&M has a group-wide responsibility to define requirements, processes and guidelines on how to conduct O&M in Statkraft and to review the implementation of these. Group O&M delivers standardized services that enable Statkraft to capture value from synergies and provides expertise support to business units in both the development and operational phases.

Job_title: Global Head of Finance Services Sales
Description:
The Company
Our client is one of the fastest growing Software companies that own the number one operating system in the cloud sold across the globe as one of the most popular development platforms. Our client`s renown Product is the fastest growing enterprise platform, the leading platform for public cloud compute, and the engineer's favorite path to dive into the future. Their aim is to help the enterprise welcome open source from end to end, across every category of compute and application, starting with infrastructure solutions such as Kubernetes and OpenStack, to data, analytics, security and serverless capabilities. Their clients range from Global 500 enterprises and telcos, and managed service providers at big scale, to fast-moving startups.
Our client provides managed services, commercial support, training and consulting services to their clients who are deploying their Product. They also support technical staff and partners to provide best guidance and practices across their projects.

Job_title: Vil du være med å skape et tryggere Norge - ved hjelp av tekniske verktøy? PST søker teknologer og analytikere!
Description:
Er du en dataentusiast med god teknisk forståelse og utpreget interesse for analyse og teknologi? Ønsker du en annerledes, unik og utfordrende arbeidshverdag hvor din fagkunnskap vil utgjøre en viktig forskjell?

Vi bygger opp vår kapasitet til å drive innhenting og utvikling i det digitale rom. Utvikling av fremtidsrettet teknologi, og innhenting og bearbeiding av informasjon er helt avgjørende for at PST skal være i stand til å løse samfunnsoppdraget. For å få til dette trenger vi flere dyktige kollegaer som har potensialet for å bli den aller beste innenfor fagfeltet.

Praktisk erfaring og ferdigheter er like viktig for oss som formalkompetanse, og vi oppfordrer alle kvalifiserte kandidater til å søke hos oss.

Description:
This engineering role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success of those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development, you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
The Commercial Systems unit has several areas of responsibility spread across five engineering teams, closely collaborating with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. Services designed, developed, and operated by the Commercial Systems unit are deployed to millions of machines worldwide.
The first area of responsibility is centered around security. We develop and operate Ubuntu Pro and Livepatch backend services that support the authentication, authorization, and delivery of Extended Security Maintenance (ESM) at scale to a wide range of devices spanning from individual systems to large enterprise fleets running in cloud environments.
